column1: After less than 2 weeks, black lines on screen
column2: I decided to buy this phone for myself while studying abroad in Chile. I need it mostly for using Google Maps and WhatsApp. It was very difficult to use the stock keyboard so I downloaded SwiftKey and that solved most of my problems. I used to have a galaxy s3 so learning to type on this phone was a challenge. It only recognizes one tap at a time so typing quickly and zooming in or out is a challenge.

Have owned this phone for less then 90 days and it's dead!!! Has not been dropped or wet. Can't find any information on a warranty period (my mistake) and recommend to others to consider the warranty period before purchasing this phone.

Pros: - Price - Android operating system - Comes with accessories Cons: - Weird reflective screen - Touch screen doesn't always recognize touch - Front camera is not very good For the price, it is a decent smartphone. The only big concerns I have for it are the screen. The screen has this weird reflective property that is I can only describe as similar to those weird 3D images that change from side to side where the color gets all weird and inverted (will try to attach pictures). It is more noticeable for darker colors and if the phone is held sideways or at an angle. Not too noticeable if you are looking straight at your phone but I tend to lay my phone flat on a desk while playing games or watching a show and at this angle it makes the screen and colors look weird. The phone also is not as touch sensitive as my other phones. I often try to press a button with my finger and it won't press, or try to slide the screen and it won't slide. I think it has to do with pressure, I have to apply more pressure than I did with my iphone or samsung for it to recognize. The front camera is also bad but I don't use that much at all so it's not a problem for me. Overall, price is great compared to other mainstream brands. Best if used as a temporary phone til your upgrade is up, as I can see the screen being annoying in the long run. I ended up returning mine as I just couldn't get used to the screen.

The phone is ok and i can deal with the screen some people have complained about viewing angle but this phone is actually 1.2 gig internally memory and not 4 gig. But the worst thing is the battery after several full charges only lasts two hours with the phone idle, if you are actually doing anything you can literally watch the battery meter drop like its a v8 or something, also the battery's red X's were bright red as if the battery had went for a swim. I saw one review that said they had a water damaged battery as well, perhaps if I receive a new undamaged battery that worked as it should I would update to 3 stars because the phone does run well. Have only had this phone a few days so far........

I just acquired this phone, it being my first ever "Blu" purchase. I almost immediately discovered that you cannot buy an extra battery for this model phone. I contacted about 10 public cell phone accessory websites as well, to no avail. I contacted Blu Products who referred me to their preferred dealer who handles all of the accessories for Blu Products. Upon contacting them they stated they do NOT have a battery for the Blu Advance 4.0. I am currently trading emails with Blu Products (after spending over one hour listening to music when calling them direct - finally gave up and hung up) to try and find out if this situation could possibly be true. Beware - I am telling you that if you purchase this phone - and want to subsequently buy a back up and/or additional battery - my advice is to look elsewhere.

As a phone it's ok, 3G connection is great (but will depend on you telephone company's HSDPA bands), it actually works as a wifi hotspot much faster than samsung galaxy note I, but it's user interface freezes once in a while maybe because of only 512MB RAM. Skype runs realy bad on this phone, but apart form that it realy nice for the price. Battery life is good (9/10).

column1: SIM cards are stuck. Does not work with Brightspot Mobile
column2: I wish I could give a negative star. Where do I start: * BluProducts Customer service is never available * The manual is not very clear * It does not work with Brightspot Mobile or TMobile * Beware when you slide your SIM card, don't expect it to be returned. Although it has 2 SIM slots, don't expect it to be reliable. My SIM card got stuck. My poor friend decided to see if her SIM card worked in the other slot. Both of them are now stuck!! Unable to push it out. Design looks great, but beware of the inside * Battery smells odd We are now without a phone or SIM card

column1: I wanted to like this phone, but it was impossible.
column2: I wanted to like this phone, but it was impossible. The screen quality was some of the worst I have ever seen. The viewing angles were laughably narrow. The camera was bad, like flip-phone bad. The dual sim card feature is great, unless you are only running one sim card. Then you get the joy of having a "Sim card not installed" message all the time! The dropped calls, bad audio quality, and propensity to accidentally dial numbers were just the horrible icing on the already bad cake. Needless to say, I do not recommend purchasing this device.
After 3 weeks the phone completely shut down. No power or without battery. Piece of crap phone has now been returned for a full refund.

Going in I didn't have high expectations. While I did read some reviews and saw some YouTube videos I knew not to expect much being that Blu wasn't a big box brand like LG or Samsung. However when I did receive the phone and used the phone it far exceeded any expectation that I had. The call quality if excellent. It's has Hspa+ but it will only work on T-Mobile towers so if you have Att then you would be limited to 3g. The ca cacaptive screen touch if very responsive. The UI of the device is clean and user friendly. You get full access to the Google Play store. It's a good little starter android phone. For the price and the features.......you can't possibly complai about. This device even lets you make a mobile hotspot......however you can't rename the ssid or create a WPA password. So it is open and accessible to anyone around. Again it's little to complain about. I would even try one of its big brothers such as the Blu 5.5 studio. I also read that Blu is making their first LTE device and ma already be available.

This phone is a nightmare. It's difficult to use, almost as if the buttons and controls are set incorrectly. I spent several hours trying to figure out how to reboot it (restore factory settings), and THERE IS NO WAY TO SELECT THE OPTION FOR REBOOT/ERASE, even though I finally pulled up that menu on the phone. This is the most ridiculous piece of junk I ever bought from amazon. The company (Blu Phone) has no customer service, which should tell you something. DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE.

This phone has a TERRIBLE screen. I saw the specs for it and it said TFT screen so I said ok it is a bad screen compared to my Huawei W1 which had an IPS screen but I didn't think it would be too bad since I had a Huawei Mytouch which had a TFT screen. But upon opening it I saw the worst screen I have ever layed eyes on. Even a feature phone has a better screen than this. I am not exaggerating. Viewing angles are pretty much non-existent so if you try to take a picture in the mirror for example all you will see is yourself in photo-negative form. Overall It just feels really cheap and nasty. You might say what can you expect for $80? Well that is exactly the amount that the Huawei W1 cost me and it is leagues better. If you are willing to pay a little more ($100-130) get the Nokia 635 which is much better still. At these price ranges, with Android, you are just going to find really gross phones. If you want a cheap but good phone you're going to have to go with WindowsPhone. SUSPICIOUS REVIEWS. There is a bunch of people leaving reviews for this phone with very simplistic unspecific reviews like "excellente." I clicked on their user profiles. And they all have only one review on their profiles- for this phone. Do not be fooled!

column1: Great phone minus the horrible viewing angle
column2: Important! Please understand that the viewing angle on this phone is HORRIBLE! You have to angle the screen in front of you a certain way or else the image fades to black. Even if you tilt the phone down slightly, the image quality changes drastically. For this very reason, the front camera is near useless. You can't see yourself on the screen because the viewing angle is so low. You will see a darkened version of you and you'll just have to hope for the best when you take the picture. Going from a Samsung Galaxy S2 to this phone, I noticed an immediate difference in the viewing angle. Keep this in mind. With all of that being said... this is an EXCELLENT entry-level phone. The battery holds a longer charge than my GS2. You get Android version 4.2 with the phone (latest is 4.4 as of this writing) so it's not completely upgraded, but version 4.2 is good enough. I got this phone primarily because I switched from Sprint to Tmobile and effectively reduced my bill by 50%. I'm liking it a lot so far, minus the viewing angle mentioned. This phone takes GSM chips, so it works on Tmobile. One thing that I dislike is that my mobile data speed is much lower than I thought I would get according to the coverage map. I get about 1mbps down/upload but I don't think this is a problem with the phone in itself. It is capable of higher speeds, for sure. The phone's viewable screen size is smaller than the GS2's. I don't really mind. I have smaller hands, so it's more comfortable for me to hold than the GS2. Another con with this is that the processing speed is slower than I thought. I notice that there is sometimes "lag" when I use swipe to type messages on Facebook messenger. It might just be the app, although I haven't experienced this on my GS2. The phone comes with a battery, earphones, a screen protector, and a plastic case. This is very thoughtful of this company to include so many accessories. You get an all-encompassing package with the purchase of your phone. I think that's a great deal. Overall, love the phone minus the horrible viewing angle. If they could fix that (not sure if they have in later versions), then this phone can easily earn 4-5 stars.

this phone is just the right size, not a big/large cumbersome tablet/phone. so far, I like all the features, although I cant get the video calls working, there is no manual to show you how. there are 2 things I DO NOT LIKE AT ALL, ONE, THIS PHONE IS ADVERTISED AS 4G, IT IS NOT. THE BOX SHOWS 3G. AND IT KEEP DROPPING CALLS. ALSO THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE, IS THE WORSE, YOU MUST BE PREPARED TO JUST WAIT TILL SOMEONE TALKS TO YOU.

column1: What a lost opportunity... BLU Advance 4.0
column2: The phone worked well for two months, but two weeks ago it got stuck on start up screen. What they say about the screen is true, it's hard to see it if you're not in front of it, which is a "security feature" by itself. Looks of the phone are great, it seems more expensive than it is. Camera quality is below average, enough for the occasional photo in broad daylight albeit not good for night shots. Storage can be expanded as much as you want, as it uses micro SD cards and regular size SIM cards (two of them). I'm still to find a cell operator whose SIMs don't work on this phone. None of these flaws or virtues were a deal breaker, as they were pretty much what I expected. But the phone doesn't move past the BLU start up screen, rendering it useless. Fixing it might be worth more than the phone itself, and the return window is behind me, so, off to the recycling bin it goes. I am giving BLU a second chance and bought the BLU Studio 5.0, which I'll duly review in two months. Be very aware of the price point, set your expectations accordingly and you might be granted a nice surprise. For me, I didn't expect much, and didn't receive much.

it's pretty good but it drops calls all the time!!!! doesn't matter if i am driving or if i'm just sitting in my home. 95% of the time i have to call someone back! it's very annoying!! that's my main complaint but it's also not user friendly. i give it 3 stars because it does everything i need it to, just annoying at times.

does a great job at almost everything you'd need it for. not to impressed with the camera though and GPS guidance drops often when using other features during navigation. ordered it with a group of other items, definitely functions just as advertised, received quickly and using currently, thanks
this phone never worked. calls dropped everytime and texts came in randomly. sent it back by mail and never recieved my refund. rip-off warning

column1: Terrible Viewing Angle and Front Camera
column2: I got this phone for my mom but when I first used it to test it out I was disgusted. First the viewing angle of the screen absolutely sucks. You have to look directly parallel to the screen to view anything clearly, look at an angle and it sucks. The front facing camera us terrible even in a well lighted area. Terrible phone. I switched this phone and got my mom the BLU Life Play S and she loves that phone and I have the BLU Life Pure. Those are great phones with great cameras which i recommend, this one I highly do not recommend.

The phone's touch screen and buttons work great. Voice and sound quality is great as well. However, Camera is completely useless, and the viewing angles are way way too narrow, even indoors. Apart from that, the phone runs really smooth with no delay or lag. A great deal if you can get it around 80 bucks.

column1: phone is good but battery life sucks
column2: when I got this phone I love it but then when I started to load the apps I was disappointed with the shortness of time the battery runs out. I hope that the manufacturers can fix this problem if they do I will definitely get a next one

column1: Cheap Android Phone, can't expect much
column2: What I Like: -Decent, Solid feel -Price -Speaker quality is okay (ear piece and loud speaker) -Wireless connections work properly -Dual SIM is a nice feature -Expandable MicroSD storage What I don't like: -If you set it down wrong it will shut down, I have no idea how or why but if I set it on my counter a certain way it will reboot, no it is not dropped or thrown on the counter, honestly have no idea why. -Slow responsiveness to touch screen(but then again you paid $90 for this..) -Claim to be getting HSPA+ or HSPA when I know for a fact that I am no; At my camp(in the middle of nowhere where no other phone gets anything other that EDGE and the occasional 3G) this phone claims to have HSPA+ and HSPA. but then will not load anything internet related, not sure what the deal is what that, Obviously not HSPA there. Conclusion: Overall its a phone, nothing very fancy but its a cheap android phone(exactly what I was looking for) there are some flaws with this device, but then again only paid $90 for it. If you want something to work like a high-end phone, then you gotta pay for a high-end phone. BIGGEST ANNOYANCE: When it turns off because you set it down wrong..

column1: You get what you pay for -no service no support
column2: One of the worst purchases I have ever made. Of course, I am sure all the 4 and 5 star people are happy with their phone because they were lucky and got a good one. It looks like about 10 to 15% of us get the units that won't work. So you have about a 85 to 90 percent chance you get a good phone. Not a good design in my experience. There is no support from Blu. The user manual is pretty useless as well. The cell phone I got has intermittent failure with the bluetooth connection. One day it works, one day it doesn't. The WiFi connection has never worked even though the WiFi signal indicator says I am getting a strong signal. Everyone's thinking Blu is going to challenge Samsung. Well if they keep producing junk like the phone I have, I think the boys at Samsung are safe.

column1: The phone has decent specs for the price, but the limited viewing angle makes it almost impossible to use.
column2: I have a BLU Studio 5.0 which I love, so I thought this would be great too. The specs are decent, the reviews are good, and the price is right, so I took a chance. I was very disappointed as soon as I powered the phone on. I noticed right away that unless I held the phone at the perfect angle, I couldn't see what was on the screen. I saw another reviewer mention this issue, but I had no idea it would be as bad as it is. I would honestly suggest spending a few more dollars and getting the BLU Studio 5.0 as it doesn't suffer from this issue.

Very disappointing! I bought two of these for an international trip and paid for expedited shipping only to receive two phones with defective batteries. The two batteries had their moisture (humidity) indicator pink which means that I was sent bad batteries. It's frustrating that I'm forced to leave a bad comment before even getting to try the phones. Now I have to see how good/bad they will respond in replacing these batteries. But one thing for sure is that I'll be going on my trip with no phone :( Thanks a lot BLU!!!

column1: The phone does not make or receive calls
column2: I open the phone and I realized that it REQUIRES AN Nano to Micro/Normal SIM Card Adapter. So I went to buy one. I turned on the phone, it detected my chip but the phone couldn't make or receive any calls. I couldn't load any websites or the Google play store. I have a One Plus and I am on AT&T 4G LTE and everything works perfectly. I also tried my dad's chip on both phones. Same results, my One Plus works perfectly but not the BLU 4.0. My advice to you, read all the reviews first.

The phone is exactly as described, the front facing camera doesn't have the best quality ever, however the back camera is pretty good. The battery life isn't the best I use all my social media and as a result I have to recharge after about 10 hours daily. its pretty good.

column1: Expected more but good budget smartphone
column2: Blue Advance 4.0 is a solid budget phone riddled with caveats. Good news is that it has some free accessories like a tpu case and screen protector, which is nice, however the headphones includes look and probably are garbage. The dual sim feature is great for some people but not me. The real problem with the phone can be seen when you first use it, for one, the screen is terrible. Even on max brightest, the view angles are awful, and even compared to my 5 year old galaxy s, which had a super amoled panel, it is waves better then this. Other technical pet peeves are that it only has 512 mb of ram, not enough, was hoping for 1gb at least. The android skin has semblance to stock jelly bean, which is fine, but I still feels quite laggy, for example require several presses on the capacitive to register a home or back action. Other problems is that it has pretty low internal storage at only 4gbs, but is expandable with a micro sd card. Though the price is however, very compelling, and though I do recommend spend an extra $30 or so dollars on a better low end smartphone like the moto E, you can't go wrong with $90 for this blu phone.

column1: Check your battery's moisture indicator if you ordered from Amazon
column2: This is my first "smart phone." I received it only a few days ago and have already had a few issues. For one, the battery arrived with water damage as indicated by the pink moisture indicator on the battery. The phone was on standby for a day and the battery was drained by morning. I dislike that you can't turn the phone on when the battery is dead and you are charging it. Also, at full volume, the call volume is very low, even on speaker. The placement of the on/off button is directly across from the volume rocker, so you end up pressing both. The phone goes to sleep (a black screen) while you are talking on the phone, so you have to press the on/off button to wake it up in order to end the call, which is annoying. I wish it had a camera button, rather than having to navigate to it on the screen. It also randomly makes a notification sound when there is no reason for it. I am sort of missing my "dumb" phone, which never had any issues for years until recently, which is why I switched to this phone.
check the 5 star reviewers for this phone "recent reviews". you will se hundreds of reviews posted today for this "person". FALSE ADVERTISING! LIES FOR REVIEWS>

I've had this phone 2 months and it has become a major problem. It drops calls or randomly puts them on mute. It does not stay connected to my blue tooth, so I have to reconnect almost every time. The icons move on their own and apps often open independently. I have not been able to open any MMS messages. The customer service department is slow. I have never spoken to anyone because I have been on hold for up to 30 minutes on the several times when I have called. All my correspondence has been through e-mail. Now I have to mail the phone back to them for repairs, at my expense. On the plus side, this phone does far more than the owners manual lists. It has been fun discovering all the nice things it does do. I would like a more inclusive owner's manual though because I am not as tech savvy as I would like to be. If it did not drop calls it would be a great phone. If customer service was more accessible, I might be more inclined to give it 3 stars.
Good starter phone does the basics well, the package arrived in decent time, and condition. The phone is not thin a bit too bulky but feels good in the hand, thank you.

column1: My experience with it was horrible.
column2: This is one of the worst experiences I have had with a cell phone. It is clunky, slow, not responsive at all, constantly lagged, took forever for apps to open and function, and has one of the worst displays I have had in a phone. The viewing angles were enough to make me cry. I have upgraded tot he BLU Studio 5.0 C HD and it is like day and night. I would not recommend this phone to anyone including people who drive slow in the far left lane, Justin Beiber, or even members of ISIS.

column1: Might be the worst phone I've ever purchased. This seller uses fake reviews!!!!!
column2: Stay away from this Phone!!!!! I have no idea why so many people gave it a good review. My only guess would be either Blu makes their own employee's leave good reviews or 90% of the people never switched from a flip phone or something and this was their first smart phone. Where to start. Firstly the screen sucks. Unless you are looking directly at the screen with it literally at eye level you can not see it. Looking at it from any other angle than directly in front of your face holding it straight up results in a washed out terrible looking screen (think old school LCD TV's where if you were sitting to the left or right of the TV you saw a washed out dimly lit screen. Also the phone does not accept multiple finger touches, so using two fingers to zoom/unzoom the screen etc.. does not work. Secondly and most importantly the phone has only 500mb of system ram. The operating system uses a good amount of that up just running it's background services. What that means is that any apps that are bigger and more complex (facebook, teamstream, youtube, etc. run very slowly, or worse, hard lockup your phone causing you to have to remove the battery. Having low ram also means that apps do not run correctly in the background to give you alerts such as instant message apps like hangouts, facebook messenger, etc.. The only time I would get a alert from a message in hangouts was if I had the app open. The phone would immediately stop the app from running in the background when I closed it, meaning no alerts from messages, and wouldn't ring my phone when I used hangouts with my google voice number over wifi. There is no way to upgrade the ram in cell phones. If your using this phone for anything other than calling or texting, maybe checking email then do not buy it. You would be much better off (if your looking for a bargain) to get a phone like the HTC Desire 510 which is about 50 bucks at bestbuy and amazon and has a quad core processor with double the system ram at 1 gb. This phone has a dual core processor at 500mb system ram.

Absolute garbage. Lasted for 2 weeks. Woke up one morning, the screen flickered and was completely dead. Nice main camera, good battery life. Poor screen quality, slippery cheap case. Fast shipping :/
Bought two from amazon and they never worked got a refund and now they want me to ship them back I'm an international buyer it's two expensive ..... Great phone but I was unlucky

UPDATE:I ended up returning this phone because after only a few days of use the reaction time of the phone slowed down to the point of it being annoying. I would not recommend this phone. I would rather save the $85 and spend it on a phone that will perform well for a longer time. This is a basic smart phone. It is good for making phone calls, using the internet and the maps app. There are also some apps that will be fine on this phone. Beyond these functions this phone will come up lacking. It has a stock keyboard that will need replacing. The swift or Google keyboards will work. Also to watch any videos I have to hold the phone tilted to the left to see the screen clearly. The screen is the old basic small size. And the speaker is terrible. So if you want a good multimedia phone get something bigger and more expensive. If you just want to make calls and use the internet and maps every now and then or are just on a budget this is the phone for you.

column1: Not at all what the reviews said
column2: This was the worse phone I have ever had and I have had some cheap phones. It wouldn't down load pictures, it dropped EVERY call after a minute, it was not a phone it was a door stop with a battery. I sent it back and got something different.

My father purchased this phone for me when the keyboard on my previous phone of nearly 5 years died. I mention this because I take care of my phones and I have not had one last less than 3 years before. This phone with its lower price and high ratings, as well as extensive reviews, seemed a good choice. Much as I hate to admit it you get what you pay for. The phone lasted a little over a month. This morning when I went to gather my various electronics from my little charging area I found that the phone had- for lack of a better descriptor- died. The phone had been in my possession just long enough to not qualify for replacement or refund. Now I'm shelling out for another phone during the Christmas season, after paying through the nose for a semester of graduate school. Granted, the stress is running high and the emotions are strong. However, the phone died. Oops take that back can't get a phone apparently. ouch.

column1: Battery life is great, but the reason for two stars is simple
column2: Phone's fast and a definite improvement over my 6 year old Nexus One (obviously). Battery life is great, but the reason for two stars is simple. I don't like the screen. As the number one most helpful comment posted, viewing the phone from different angles distorts the display a considerable amount. But that's not all. The touchscreen is even worse than the screen's display. Playing rhythm music apps requires you to anticipate for "lag" and wherever you touch on the screen isn't always pinpoint accurate. I don't have fat fingers (5"6, 125lbs) so when I have difficulty texting or typing in an url, it's frustrating. After installing a screen protector from EZGuardZ, performance increased considerably but still insufficient. Basically, viewing display for the phone is distorted and the touchscreen receptivity fails to meet my standards. I'm used to the touchscreen of an iPod Touch. Edit: Phone battery has gotten worse, dying much faster now.

column1: but a loud buzzing on the line renders it basically useless as a phone
column2: I got this as a gift, and it had issues right out of the box. I can forgive having to switch carriers to use it, but a loud buzzing on the line renders it basically useless as a phone. When I tried to have it replaced, the company told me to perform a hard reset (for an apparent hardware issue, no less) and gave me a number to call if that didn't work... a number to call for the phone that can't make clear calls. It's obvious to me that no one even read my report. At this point I'll probably just have it returned and find a more reliable manufacturer. From the research I did before I got it, I think it would be a fantastic phone if it worked. However, if you happen to get one that doesn't (or if something happens to it later), then in my experience you're SOL. Take that under advisement before buying this phone.

column1: the internal memory on the phone went bad and i lost the phone in three months
column2: the internal memory on the phone went bad and i lost the phone in three months. nice phone but the whole deal was a gimmick

column1: First I thought I was getting a good deal with this purchase since the product arrived on ...
column2: It really does not worth spending money and time on unknown brands for a smartphone. I am a mac/samsung user, and bought this phone as a gift for my niece. First I thought I was getting a good deal with this purchase since the product arrived on time and in good condition. The phone worked fine for two days, and in the third day, it started to display horrible lines on the screen, making the phone difficult to use. Now I have to get a replacement, plus the hassle of finding the piece or returning the product. I will definitely stick to well-known brands, like Apple, Samsung, LG, Nokia, HTC, so on and so forth.
Sometimes it freezes and I'm forced to take battery out to reboot but for the cost I can't complain.

column1: Garbage: slow and impossible to type on
column2: Garbage. I tried to get a cheap unlocked phone before traveling to India for six months and boy was buying this a terrible decision. This phone is terribly slow and is unable to help me in using very basic apps like Uber or Snapchat. On top of that they keyboard is impossible to use. Very hard to type something without having to backspace a million times and retype. Overall, terrible phone. I ended up buying another one as soon as I got to India because I couldn't stand using this one. Slow and crappy phone. do not buy.

column1: Once Battery is dead, you cannot use phone again
column2: This is a terrible product. I bought this because I thought it is cheaper. I just need something temporary for a business phone line for the small business I work at. But once battery is dead. There's no way that you can charge and turn on the phone again. This happened to me twice. First time, I returned the product. This time around, I realized I past the date that's possible to return the product. And hence, I have wasted close to 100 dollars. Would not purchase this, if I can do it over again.

TERRIBLE PHONE. I've had this phone since March and it is /very/ defective. The first thing I noticed was the camera. On the product page, it shows great quality, thats a lie. The pictures come out worse than they do on an ipod touch 4th generation. There is no notepad app, which is usually standard. The screen cracked even with the screen protector and case that is included. Take my word for it and just spend a little more money for a galaxy, iphone, htc..... anything but BLU.

column1: I'm sure nobody uses there phone like this so I would assume this phone could last ...
column2: I kept the phone on airplane mode, kept brightness on 10%, and played perk tv for 9 and a half hours before the charge went out. I'm sure nobody uses there phone like this so I would assume this phone could last a day for most people but I also know that most people don't keep their phone on airplane mode all day as well as lowering the brightness to 10%. Since most people don't use these settings I don't recommend this phone for extreme users, but for light users.

column1: I didn't like this cellphone because you couldn't hear with them and ...
column2: I didn't like this cellphone because you couldn't hear with them and I have at& t network with my old phone you could hear perfectly once I started using this phone it was very hard to hear you couldn't have a normal conversation you were all the time asking the other to repeat what they were saying, the screen was very sensitive people were calling me saying I have called them when the phone was in my pocked, cell phone was very heavy

column1: it was too good to be true, it last 3 days
column2: I bought the phone while I was in the US with the idea of bringing it to my country as it was an unlocked phone. I opened the package and the phone seemed great, I use it for 2 days and all good, the morning of day 3 the phone was damage without any explanation... the scream was flashing, I took the battery out and try reboot the phone to see if that solve the problem but nothing... too good to be true

This phone was working fine for about 2 weeks,and it started popping error messages every time I tried to do something with the phone. I did factory reset at least 5 times because I thought it was software problem, but even factory reset didn't fix the problem. It seems it was a compatibility issue. I refunded it. However, if it wasn't the popping errors messages, I would have kept the phone.

How can you even say it's a good value for the price? Sure, it's fun for the ONE MONTH the thing will actually work before the operating processes start crashing and it dies completely. Maybe you have $100 a month and the patience to keep replacing this phone, but I don't and it's not worth it. No amount of antivirus or cleaning software or factory resets will keep this piece of junk running.

column1: Got white screen problem in only 3 days!!
column2: It worked well...For 3 days only!! Then the screen all of a such turned completely white. And nothing could bring it back. No button is responding. Can't even turn if off by holding on to the power button. Tried to take out the battery. That turned it off. But when I turned it back on, the screen was still white -- and nothing else.. no response, what so ever... rather pissed here...

column1: I think that this phone is good but I do not know that is it true ...
column2: This Phone is a fake because it says that has 1.3 Gz Processor and 512MB RAM, I had another phone with 887Mhz Processor and 512MB RAM and it ran a lot of games over 400MB this phone does not do, simply close the app and return to main window, I think that this phone is good but I do not know that is it true all capacities.

column1: It is a good phone but does not work on GSM 900 frequency - Frequency 3G UMTS / HSDPA: 900 Mhz - Frequency 4G (LTE): 1800Mhz
column2: It is a good phone but does not work in the H + frequency 900 (Digitel) Venezuela nor for the companies operating in this frequency but at this price is an excellent buy, another important thing the flash is poor, buying not forget to check these details ... in the case of Venezuela only works with Movilnet and Movistar.

column1: Decent phone, terrible company. My advice: avoid it or insure your phone.
column2: I have used Blu phones (this model and other ones) for several years, and so has my family. I've recommended their phones to others. But no more. It's over Blu, and I'm really sad about it! Previous to this summer, I really liked what Blu did - make unlocked phones of good quality for this price range, expandable and customizable, many device options, US-based company, real US-based Customer Service. While the phones aren't terribly sturdy, I didn't pay for sturdy at this price, and the other aspects of the phone are respectable, especially for people who don't need (or want) to pay for high-end brand names or who are just entering the Smartphone world. My previous review of this phone on another site praised it for being a very good, inexpensive smart-phone option. It's pretty user-friendly, is expandable with it's SD slot, has 2 SIM slots (great for a business line!), comes with lots of accessories for free, has good reception, speeds, and customizability. It was sturdier, smarter, and nicer than I thought it would be at this price. I really liked it. When I dropped and broke my first one after over a year using it, I immediately bought another! However, the most recent one I got was defective, and my experience with the company has been HORRENDOUS! I have spent over a month on this with no resolution. I initiated my case online and waited for weeks with no contact. I finally got sent a replacement - a dirty, obviously used replacement with a different IMEI that was missing the backplate! I called, they said they were sorry and they'd resolve it... and then the case file was deleted after my call. But they sent me several more emails asking me to contact them and tell them "what's wrong with the device". My second call I was told that this was an acceptable replacement and there was no other avenue to contact them or escalate the claim. I even called their corporate office and the receptionist hung up on me after telling me she can't tell me anything! I called back later and the recording said that phone line was no longer in service! Yikes! I was shocked that any professional company would go to such lengths to avoid customers! Sad day, I used to really like them. It's like a bad breakup. I have filed a complaint with the BBB. However, I see that Blu no longer responds to customers in Amazon reviews these days (they used to sometimes) and most of their cases are not satisfactorily resolved through the BBB, so I really have no hope that they care about customers any more. I'm feeling VERY grateful that I insured the phone through Amazon, who in the past has been amazing about servicing their claims. I will be taking that route after posting this review. I'm sad that this is likely to be the end of the road between me and Blu. They used to be such a quality company, and I'm genuinely sad to see a US company that provided a much-needed unlocked smartphone option go downhill like this. =(

They say it works with Cricket Wireless but it doesn't. Cricket recommended I take it to a Cricket store and see if the technicians could possibly make it work. What a hassle. Took it to the Cricket dealer and they said NO THIS WILL NOT WORK WITH CRICKET

wasted my money.The phone is trash all three phones locked up and stop working, so dissatisfied and my three grandkids were so disappointed. Now i have to buy them three more phones. Stop selling blu phones
broke after 1 day. Started out okay, the screen quality was pretty bad but it did the job I wanted it to. If you buy it, give it to a kid who won't take care of it.

column1: Good to make and receive calls, and that's where it ends.
column2: I was finally teased enough that I stepped up from my slider phone to this one. I like the size and feel of it, but it has some shortcomings. I was most excited about getting on Facebook from my phone and being able to take selfies like all my friends. Not a good phone for that. I found out the internet connection, or processor, was poor so Facebook and most apps didn't run well. I am with TMobile, but it didn't work well on Wi-Fi either which is ATT at home. I also found out that the front facing camera was very poor, so the selfies were out all together. I use Bluetooth headsets very often and they didn't sync well with voice commands on the phone either. If you need a phone to answer and receive calls for a good price, this is it. If you want connectivity and even good pictures, it is not.

The phone is kind of slow running apps, The so-called 5 MP camera is terrible, I can't get a good picture with this phone at all. The battery only lasts me 1 day if I am using it and that is not with intense apps either, just music and taking some pictures. The flash won't work with the installed camera? I tried another camera app and the flash works but the picture is still very low light and grainy even though I had lights on in the house. Outside the pictures are a little better but not much. Maybe mine isn't working up to par? I don't really know how others phone are at taking pictures and stuff. I want to like this phone so bad but it is just another cheap phone that you can download some apps. Can someone tell me if their camera feature on this phone is good?

column1: Horrible Phone, if you buy you will be disappointed!!!!!
column2: If I could give this review "0" stars I would. I bought this phone for my mother because she's been using her flip phone for the longest. So I figured that this would be a great start off touch screen phone for her... Boy was I wrong. The main function of the most simplistic phone is to actually send and receive calls. We tried to send calls that worked, but no matter how much I called her phone from different numbers and no matter how much coverage it showed that she had she still wasn't able to receive my phone calls! I am extremely disappointed! This is a shame how they take money knowing that there phone device is a piece of crap! The phone will be going right in the garbage where it belongs! Thanks for the waste of time, money and a decent surprise.

I am so disappointed with this cell phone. It worked just fine for about four months and then it started giving me problems. First, it freezes very often. Secondly, the GPS does not work at all (I know it's not my carrier because I tried my SIM card in a different phone). And lastly the company does not honor it's warranty. After dealing with so many problem with this product, I tried calling and emailing the company before my warranty expired. For two months I received the run around from them-- having me fill out service requests online, not responding to phone calls, etc-- then as soon as my warranty had expired, I received an email from them telling me that they are sorry and could not repair my device. I will never buy a BLU product again.
Its a phone it works as a phone and can text but there are lots of apps in google play that i cannot download

column1: Wish it was better than it is
column2: This is a frustrating purchase. Other reviewers are a little too forgiving of this phone's shortcomings due to the low cost I think. I'm giving one star because the receiving bays for sim card 1 and sim card 2 are not conducive for T-Mobile sim cards, IMO (too big, the card essentially swims around inside each receiving bay). After repositioning numerous times and booting to no avail, I pulled the sim and put it back into my old phone, confirming it works and fortunately was not scratched to the point of disrepair. Instructions for sim placement is also vague and poorly written. Ultimately thankful my sim wasn't broken and processed the return for this phone on the same day I received it.

column1: It's ok, but not so good
column2: It's a good choice for a low price, if you don't have too much budget to get an unlocked smart cell phone. Many apps can be installed and the speed is good, as well the voice quality. The Dual SIM is awesome, if you are using two phone numbers. Totally, I was satisfied. However, I found some drawbacks since i use it for two months. 1. its RAM is only 512MB, so too many apps can't be open. 2. Sometimes it stuck in the start screen "BLU" when it was open after shut down. But it will be fine, my solution is that I unload the battery and restart it again. 3. Nowdays, the camera fail to work, and it says "Unfortunately, Gallery has stopped". it seems the same problem for other andriod phone. I'm trying to figure it out.

column1: Just Tilt it slightly and see what happens
column2: Worse viewing angle. May be good for international travel but not for day to day personal use.

column1: It`s not a bad phone for the price but I wouldn`t say it`s ...
column2: It`s not a bad phone for the price but I wouldn`t say it`s really good either. The worst thing is the screen. It`s clear only when you`re inside and you`re looking straight at it, otherwise the light is REALLY bad and for a person who does a lot of video calls it sucks big time. Screen doesn`t always react on the first touch so you have to do it couple of times and it can be frustrating. I use it mostly on wi-fi and if I open couple of tabs it slows down a lot and then just stops responding so I have to reboot it. Camera is also not the best thing but I guess it will do until I can buy something better.

WELL...my only complaint with this phone is that it's not clear and my boyfriend is constantly complaining that he can't hear me. If that would change, this would have a higher rating because it's a very easy phone for as reading the screen, placing calls and accessing applications. other than the speaker not being clear enough and sounding distorted, this is a good phone for the price...I constantly question, would the sound have been better if I paid a couple of $$ more and went with the 5 as opposed to this one??

column1: This device is excellent but unfortunately has software problems
column2: This device is excellent but unfortunately has software problems, I bought two and after one months(with days of difference) of usage both stopped working for no reason. They reboot every time in the logo screen and never went beyond that. Blu has no support at all but thankfully with the community on the internet I found a solution and they worked again. So my recommendation for anyone buying this is 1) Root it 2) Install CWM 3) Download the stock ROM and save it on your computer just in case.

column1: This is a terrible phone. It easily gets bogged down by apps ...
column2: This is a terrible phone. It easily gets bogged down by apps running. Facebook, the phone book and other stuff. Heck, just entering your numerical password bogs it down as you enter 4 separate numbers to access the phone, you can tell that it hangs a bit. I do not recommend this phone for kids or adults. I've had it for a week and it has convinced me it is too irritating to work with. Why would anyone want a phone that delays much of the the time. Not on occasion, ALMOST ALWAYS!!!

column1: Worst online purchase I've ever made. WOW--and I read the reviews!
column2: Worse phone investment ever. The phone was done 4 months ago and I've not even had it a year. Read all the reviews. The majority were positive. I feel cheated. Gets stuck, have to turn on/off. Scrolling half works (by month 6th). Pictures were HORRIBLE from day 1. Forget about anything after dark. Worst flash ever. Sad resolution. I guess you GET what you pay for. This is probably the worst online purchase I've ever made. Well--in that light, that's not bad. But this phone is!!!

column1: Read reviews... this us best bought as a phone... and for very light phablet type usage
column2: there were enough positive reviews for me to jump on this item for 60 dollars... but the negative reviews turned out to be more accurate. this is great for a child or as a spare phone, but is too often and randomly sluggish both in terms of video playback as well as typing on the keyboard to be used for the internet or email writing or video watching. the camera lacks exposure lock so its hard to take decent pictures. its inexpensive... but based on reviews I was expecting more.

column1: but it nothing made it better. if you look at it from the side ...
column2: Absolutely awful cell phone!!! Does not work at ALL! You cannot look at the screen directly, because it looks dark. I tried every which way to adjust the settings, but it nothing made it better. if you look at it from the side you can see the image a little bit. but there's no point on having this cell if you cannot see the screen. Returning it within 3 days of getting it, only because it was on a weekend that I got it. DO NOT GET THIS PHONE!

column1: This phone was horrible! The idea of it being unlocked appealed greatly ...
column2: This phone was horrible! The idea of it being unlocked appealed greatly to me that's why I purchased it. After you get it you find out why it wasn't that expensive. The ram on the device is very low, 512mb I think. After the first day, it started freezing on me. I had to keep taking the battery out to reboot the Damn thing! Every time I tried to open Facebook, it took forever. The reason for all of this was the low memory. It simply couldn't keep up!

column1: Not a good phone. I've had it for 5 months and ...
column2: Not a good phone. I've had it for 5 months and the smart phone applications are not easy to use. In addition, I agree with one of the other reviewers, when you put your cheek up to talk on the phone, the phone keeps hanging up. You have to use speakerphone or the headphones. In addition, the online manual does not contain much useful information. This was my first smartphone and I've basically been using it like a nonsmartphone.

column1: You get what you pay for.
column2: Phone won't multitask GPS navigation and Spotify without exiting navigation, drops calls consistently, typing on the phone is basically not worth the frustration due to the slow and inaccurate touch screen response. Don't really understand the 4.5/5 rating on Amazon - this phone sucks in my opinion. It was, however, only $75 for an unlocked Android phone. For a dual core 1.X Ghz processor, this phone runs slow as hell!

column1: The batteries are over heating and smelling so bad. I feel so sad about it
column2: I ordered this Blu Adavance 4.0 two(2) in December 19th 2014(one black and white), received it on the Dec 26th 2014 As of today March 13th , the phones are dead already, Refuse to power up. The batteries are over heating and smelling so bad. I feel so sad about it. I wanted to it and I saw the return policy elapsed January 31st 2015. I will not recommend any one to buy the phone. So Sad.

I could not answer calls on this phone. When a call came in, I swiped the screen, but instead of answering the call, the phone went straight to the message screen (to send a message to the caller as to why you didn't answer). I tried everything, to no avail. I sent the phone back and got a replacement. The new phone had the exact same problem. This phone is defective. Do not buy it.

column1: How do I return an item from outside the USA and get a refund back?
column2: I purchased a Blu Advance 4.0 Unlocked Dual Sim Phone (white). This phone was purchased less than 2 months ago and has stopped working. How do I go about getting a refund? I live outside the United States of America and it worked well for the few weeks I had it ( I had two sim cards in it). However, the screen is now stuck on the word "BLU" and is not booting up.

On paper, the Advance 4.0 is great. It has all the features any decent Android phone would have, the best being that its Android distribution is vanilla, with little to no OEM bloatware commonly found in Samsung and Moto phones. I must say, however, that the screen is garbage. The colors are bad, the viewing angles are horrendous, not particularly touch sensitive compared to my previous Atrix II. Also, the whole bottom 20% of my phone's touch surface is completely defective and there is a massive difference between finger location and cursor- but mine's probably a rare occurrence and my rating doesn't reflect that.

column1: Slow, returned it and bought something else for same price
column2: Very slow performing tasks. I am not sure, but it was probably refurbished. It did not react immediately to touch, I needed to keep touching the screen over and over until it did what it needed to do. Camera did not have auto-focus, so needed to be very still to take good pictures and didn't work with certain apps such as QR or bar code scanner. I returned it and got an LG for same price, that works perfectly for my needs. Would recommend LG brand, I had one before that was fantastic, but I accidentally broke it, so had to get a new one.

column1: No useful information is found in it
column2: Issues as of Day 1. Bluetooth does not work. Support clueless as to what to do. Read through product guide. I think they paid there competition to write this for them. No useful information is found in it. I had to google how to install sim card. Garbage phone from a fly by night garbage company. Buy the windows phone save yourself time and money.

column1: Poor audio quality during voice calls
column2: Ordered this as a replacement for my HTC android phone. It works okay, except for during voice calls. The volume would slowly drop during the call to the point where I could not hear the person on the other end of the line. No volume adjustments made any difference. Submitted a BLU support ticket via their website, and never heard back from them.

For making and receiving phone calls purposes, this works just fine. Meantime, camera is junk (so much so I do not even use it); apps start/responds slowly - to reboot alone as it can slow down due to using games, it will take about a good 1 minute. But, for the price, and because I can use this mainly for cell phone purposes, it's worth it. Update as of Aug. 11 - I recently purchased bluetooth headset, then started noticing sound difference when I listen to music in my laptop and this BLU Advance cell phone ... much better on laptop. I did a bit of research and found Samsung is a top on sound music. I ordered one, and sure enough - noticeable difference. I then gave away my BLU Advance cell phone to a cousin. Thus, 2 main cons of this BLU cell phone: poor camera, and not-so-fancy music sound quality

I purchased this a few months back. I wanted to give it time before reviewing. I know some BLU phones that are better than this one. It's ok, but sometimes the call quality sucks. Also, the net does not work as great on this like other phones in this same space. It is not always bad though. I guess it has its days lol.

All three of my kids have had these phones. They are complete junk. One of them just went off and would never come back on, Another one the screen is flickering and jumping, and the last one won't keep your settings. They have all been purchased at different places. They work long enough for the warranty that's it!

I just received the white version of the phone (January, 2014; it took a few days from the Florida location to get across the country). Here are some pluses and minuses that I have experienced so far: Pluses: + =================== For my purposes, I needed a phone that would both work with Wind Mobile (1700 band) and also T-Mobile, ATT, Simple mobile, etc. While it feels and looks cheap (I wish I could find another case for it to correct that), it is reasonably fast. Also, it was really easy to root with 'framroot 1.81'. Price point: for under $100 what can you say, it gets the job done as a travel phone if you need it. IMHO (Wow! This is the first time using a hispter acronym, I embarrassed), I'd say you're better off with an unlocked Iphone 4 (craigslist $100 +) for traveling with Apple's build quality, unless again, you have a particular good reason (i.e. band) to get this. The packaging is nice enough -- comes with charger, ear buds, silicone extra case and screen protector, which I have yet to apply). Minuses: -s ==================== Compared to my daily cheap phone (a Motorolla Defy XT557) which is really quite solid, this is a much, much cheaper build. This (China) Blu is like my B1000 China phone that I previously used. Similar to the B1000, the touch screen is so-so responsive, good enough, but not up to the big brand minimum standards of both touch and build. Thus, if you had a phone like the B1000, this is not worth the upgrade unless you have a reason like I did (1700 band). Neutral: * ======================= The back half doesn't look as cheap as the front.I kind of like it The newer system (Android 4.2.2) doesn't feel as 'mentally' quick as my Defy XT. There is something about the spacing, coloring of the system access that seems off a bit. That's a really minor quibble by the way, and pretty subjective at that. Software used: ==================== 1) I use Launcher Pro Plus (an antiquated but really, really quick launcher). I can't report yet on the voice quality, but the web browsing has been reasonable enough. 2) I played with Talkatone for free wifi voip calls (and that's good until May, 2014 given the xmpp stuff that is being discontinued from google) and that worked pretty good over WiFi. 3) I use Link2SD (after the one click root method described above) and now there's much more of the 1GB internal memory left. Other tid bits: ==================== The price is a bit funky; all the press releases advertise if for $89 but I ended up paying $94.99 with shipping (which I suppose is alright). I've also seen it going for about $10 more than I paid. I say funky because I would have loved it if the big brand stores and sites (Amazon, Best Buy, etc.) matched the scores of PR releases about the phone and then gotten free shipping. Atlas, not the case. Also, I might have bought the next one up (the Studio 5 which is pr'd for $139 but sells for a fair amount higher than that). I'll update once I actually use it as a phone. :)

column1: I need my phone to react
column2: Good. I was very happy with my new phone but suddenly since month ago the phone I 've been hanging out a lot, and occasionally unresponsive, the screen goes white and so lasting an hour waiting to react not, only reacts if I remove the battery , the worst is that these last few weeks has repeated the same action.

The phone has crashed and will not work LESS THAN TEN DAYS AFTER THE RETURN PERIOD EXPIRED. Poor product, poor service, and Blu has lost a customer.

This phone does not work on Tracfone. I was told that it did so I bought it for my daughters birthday. She loved this phone. Only to disappoint her to send it back and make her wait even longer for a new phone. I'm very upset withthe sservice also. I was lied to about working with tracfone.

The phone is a bad product. I bought the phone on May 26, 2015. 25 days later, it's no functioning. The phone freezes for whatever reason I don't understand. I need to know if there's warranty on this product. Otherwise, seller should remove it from the market because it's a bad product.

Nice pack! (Cel, case, charger, screen protector and headphones) A great celphone for a little amount of money. Really fast and good internal storage space. The only con that i found was the camera... Surely isn't a 5MP one. Maybe a 3.2MP... But, still being a good choice for low cost

column2: very disappointed with this cellphone worked for three days than it won't answer prompts, keeps powering down, the scrolling doesn't work, all in all a very bad purchase I have to rate it with a star in order to register the comment and truthfully this doesn't rate a star at all

column1: They need better technology for this phone
column2: This phone did not last 2 weeks before the screen started flickering and the sound was messed up. To hear with it, I have to use earpiece or put it on speaker. It`s such a frustration to use. I can`t see pictures clearly. They need better technology for this phone, seriously !

column1: not sure if the sensor to know youre holding the phone to your face is bad or nonexistent or what
column2: had serious phone problems with this phone hanging up i think due to your cheek hitting the end call button. not sure if the sensor to know youre holding the phone to your face is bad or nonexistent or what. returning this phone and going with something different. update -- am trying out the app Cheekey Hang Up Guard FREE! to hopefully help with this issue. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.ep1c.cheekey&hl=en

column1: I am very disappointed with my purchase
column2: I am very disappointed with my purchase. I bought two of theese phones and one of them, precisely mine, does not work. It would be two expensive to return it from Venezuela, so it is not worth it. I just wanted you to know I am unhappy with my product.

The phone froze in less than 3 months. I want a full refund. Then to add insult to injury i am unable to select the "Return or replace items" button option as when i do am getting an error message. In fact the phone deserves no stars.

I have a mixed review. I ordered 2 of these phones. One works great. The second stopped working and I found it extremely difficult to find whereach to contact anyone. I did leave a message bit I have not received a response. Please help.

column2: It was a great deal, for a phone. It is fast and I love the touch screen.. The only thing that I did not like, was the calling speaker. When I'm on the phone, I can barely hear even though I have the volume all the way up.

The phone is decent definitely not what I expected while you were talking in mid conversation it will turn itself off I have to restart this phone about four or five times a day because it will stop responding I hate it

column2: this phone wasnt as good as I thought. it was actually pretty slow and would randomly exit out of open as while I was using it. dont plan on using this phone any more. hopefully I can find something better.

Absolutely doesn't work I only had for less than 3 months never dropped it... I kept it in almost perfect condition and it just won't start i factory reset it and wiped everything but it still doesn't work

this phone would go black after a call could not do anything.Had to take battery out to get it to work again.it would hang up when i would touch it against my face.I could not hear through ear piece either.

The phone would be great for the price if the screen wasn't terrible. Viewing angles are bad, with brightness and contrast changing drastically even if you're just tilting it a few degrees from center.

You know what you are getting into with a phone at this price. My old phone broke after receiving water damage, and I was forced to switch to this phone in a hurry. Pros: 1. The price - This is one of the cheapest smartphones that money can buy, while still maintaining functionality in most features 2. The guts - This phone contains little seen features in American phones such as 2 SIM Card slots and a removable battery. On a user side, the phone has an FM radio scanner that works with any headset, and has the ability to automatically turn on and off at user set times. Cons: 1. The screen - This screen looks right out of 1999, and not in a good way. This is a pretty minor point, as it is easy to get used to after a few minutes of distortion. 2. Storage space - I constantly run into situations where I cannot install apps due to "insufficient storage" even though I have 14 GB left on my micro-SD card. I am probably missing something, but they do not make it clear what the issue is. 3. No data connection (might be unique to AT&T) - I cannot access the internet in any form when outside of Wi-Fi connection. No idea how to fix this, but it definitely puts a bummer on my day at some points. Not a huge issue, since most places have Wi-Fi, but it is scary being out with no way to access Maps or ride services.
