column2: My blu, is very attractive interface, but is stuck, crashes, reboots and sometimes just need to remove the battery, commonly throws errors of application. Expected more sharpness in the camera.

column1: LG mini is a much better
column2: low quality product, phone itself is very very thick. System is slow and not responsive. Screen gives mirror effect and it's very hard to use outdoors. LG mini is a much better choice

column1: Works as a basic phone but battery life is unacceptable
column2: It works as a phone I guess. Slow, battery is almost worthless and doesn't last. I bought it as a cheap phone for my kid to carry, but if the battery doesn't last, what good is it?
0ne month only using it....it's dead. i try to reset but say: no command . all my friends say the same about this phone. and i cant return it neither refund. i spend my money

column1: I have only one reason that i liked the phone because the person that bought the phone ...
column2: this phone is vary week and barly able to last two weeks.I have only one reason that i liked the phone because the person that bought the phone got unlimited every thing.

column1: Company needs more experience / more time. You do get what you pay for.
column2: I was very excited to find this company and their line of products. The bang for the buck is there on the surface. The challenge is in execution. This phone worked very well for the first month. After that some bugs started creeping in. First it wouldn't charge completely when plugged into the charger, then it started freezing up. Now we constantly struggle with it turning on/off randomly. The only remedy sometimes is to pull the battery and start over. Lastly, BLU customer service is very unprofessional and amateur. Even the automated phone system when you call in has bugs and glitches out. I contacted them about the warranty replacement and it took 3 separate phone calls and 2 emails back and forth to finally receive an RMA approval. Now they require a 20 day turnaround to ship the phone (at my cost), assess the claim, and return the phone. They offer no advance warranty replacement and offered only excuses when I asked for an expedited process. I am torn between liking on paper the products they offer at competitive prices but disliking the support in the end. I guess the age old adage of "You get what you pay for" holds true here as well.

column1: Don't buy this phone if you want to surf web or use cell data
column2: very disappointing phone. I've now taken it to Spain for use and to the UK. The phone is simply a crummy product. I've went through 2 different SIMs in Madrid -- the data coverage and throughput was awful. I went to the first provider and attempted to troubleshoot my data throughput problems -- and the shop stated it was the phone not the SIM (they put the SIM in another phone and had no problems). I purchased another SIM from another provider (O2) and once again, had the same problems. I'm now in the UK and I thought I'd give the phone another try -- picked up a T-mobile-UK sim an once again, can't get any data to work. It runs android 4.2. It seems pretty obvious that the phone CPU is underpowered for this implementation. The screen is low quality -- washed out and very difficult to see when outside. Put simply, don't buy this phone. While it was only about $50 -- I would have spent more to have a functional phone. I'm a bit shocked that the manufacturer released a phone that's underpowered and it's ability to handle 3g data is a joke -- it crawls (despite the ads, it doesn't support 4g here in europe either )

This phone is OK for someone that needs a back up phone or someone who doesn't use apps, data, or text that often. I have T-Mobile and I was easily able to insert my sim card and use the phone. Now, I'm not super into social media but I do like to check my fb and instagram use a gps occasionally, but I wasn't able to with this phone I have data on my plan and with my previous phone the Nokia Lumia the data worked fast all the time. With this phone the data bar constantly shows either 3G and is extremely slow, or an e- or H+- and doesn't work at all. I have to connect to WiFi to use. This phone has recently decided to stop connecting to my home WiFi although the password is correct. On to texting... The touchscreen has some kind of delay and the calibration is slightly off. It also has a small vibration after every letter you press and this setting cannot be changed , or at least not easily. I'm a normal sized girl with small hands I should have no issues but I constantly have to be correcting errors while texting because the phone enters the wrong letters. That's my experience with this phone.

it was fine for 6 months, now it's all screwed up and I do not have time to spend HOURS AND HOURS on Google trying to figure out how to fix this phone. So I'm not too happy. WTF is the point of a "smart"phone when everything is a chore to use and all you can do is make calls and send texts?!?! I may as well have bought a cheap phone with only those 2 capabilities. $80 for what. For what exactly. Problems? Where to begin...: -Says storage space is running low. It's not. At all. I have plenty of space, and an 8 GB SD card with 5GB free. -Because of this, the phone's capabilities seem drastically reduced. There's a lot it won't do now just because of this BS storage issue. -Stopped syncing correctly -I cannot send emails(Gmail) -It's overall slow, freezes, jerky All this persists after I have done what I could to maintain it, clean it, keep it up to date. I've used the "All-in-One toolbox" app to manage things. Cleared the cache. Why do I have in my hand a SMARTphone that requires so much maintenance. Not worth the trouble.

The Advance 4.0 is an excellent Android platform for browsing, messaging, email, Google Maps, and many other tasks. Call clarity is excellent while it lasts. It is a lousy phone. The sensor that tells the phone it is against your face and that it should not display the "End Call" button is apparently out to lunch. On many occasions multiple users of the phone experienced premature hang-up. The screen could be seen alternately blanking and reappearing while against the user's face. A touch of the cheek to the button ended the calls. I figured a phone that has so many positive reviews must suffer an occasional crib death, and another one would work as advertised. After a speedy and smooth Amazon exchange the BLU proved the exception to the rule. #2 happily hung up on customers and a check with AT&T confirmed that the phone was sending the hang-up signal. Second phone returned. Two stars because of Amazon's excellent product return and the hope that there are a few Advance 4.0s out there providing faithful service.

(Original review) I don't use a cell phone often, but needed something that I can use for both domestic and foreign travel. Any lack of iPhone-like features this phone might have is of no consequence to me whatsoever. I just have an occasional need to make a phone call - nothing more - so for me this is about as tricked out as a phone ever needs to be - possibly more. That said, the big stink I read in some reviews here about poor screen quality seems exaggerated, and this claim truly stumps me. I have no problem making out what's on the display. I do notice that if the phone is pivoted up or down (less so from side to side), that the display fades out a bit. Seriously, is it that hard to hold the phone in its optimum viewing position? I am more than pleased with all the features of this cell phone - the most important for me are the GSM, dual Sims, unlocked features. Being able to buy a cheap no-contract-pay-as-you go wireless service here or abroad - on just one cell phone - is priceless. ? ? ? UPDATE / January 2015 I'll stand by my first review, but downgrade my star rating because the phone was a goner in just three months. I sent it back for warranty repair/replacement - they require signature confirmation on warranty returns which cost me $13. They sent me a new phone AND IT WAS DOA - IT TOO DOESN'T WORK. That's it for me - I'm not jumping through that hoop again.

I just acquired this phone, it being my first ever "Blu" purchase. I almost immediately discovered that you cannot buy an extra battery for this model phone. I contacted about 10 public cell phone accessory websites as well, to no avail. I contacted Blu Products who referred me to their preferred dealer who handles all of the accessories for Blu Products. Upon contacting them they stated they do NOT have a battery for the Blu Advance 4.0. I am currently trading emails with Blu Products (after spending over one hour listening to music when calling them direct - finally gave up and hung up) to try and find out if this situation could possibly be true. Beware - I am telling you that if you purchase this phone - and want to subsequently buy a back up and/or additional battery - my advice is to look elsewhere.

column1: i have another phone with the same camera specs and it is so much better, the camer of this BLU is not good ...
column2: camera is not what expected.. i have another phone with the same camera specs and it is so much better, the camer of this BLU is not good at all.

column1: o poor user manual -- how to install an SDHC memory ...
column2: here are some of the problems with this phone so far: o poor user manual -- how to install an SDHC memory card for example -- figure it out yourself o poor web site support -- support for this product is a short product features brochure w/ no support information WHATSOEVER -- in reality there is no web product support (that i could find) for this product o installing external memory card for the brave only -- pry the back off, remove battery, get magnifying glass to confirm direction of arrow on card slot -- then FORCE the card into the slot to the point of almost breaking the slot, before it snaps into place; sure i'll never be able to get it out again in order to upgrade... o poor placement of volume adjust buttons -- that's where human beings generally put their fingers to hold the phone... power button poorly placed as well for that matter. this phone has a lot going for it considering the price -- but m-facturer could do a better job supporting their products.

column1: Blu phone battery not up to standard.
column2: The phone seems pretty good for the price, many nice features, .BUT!!!!!!, the Company, Blu, basically showed no interest or concern to my information to them that the battery in the Blu showed water damage to the battery in that it, the batteries water damage indicator showed red x's and the battery SEEMED to be loosing charge at an unacceptable rate in spite of establishing all safeguards possible to lessen battery loss. They responded to my information about the battery by saying "you will have to contact the point of sale person (Amazon), or buy a new battery." I would NOT recommend their product because of the battery problem. I find Blu's refusal to replace the battery unacceptable. All is well because of Amazon,s IMMEDIATE concern and response : They credited me the price of a new battery that I found on their site, and thanks to them it is in-route to me now. THANKS AMAZON, YOU ARE THE MOST AMAZING INTERNET COMPANY ON THE NET !!

column1: cant seem to get it to perform. am using ...
column2: cant seem to get it to perform. am using it in India and now regrating it. i will be returning this product as soon as i am back in US.

column1: Decent phone for the price, but has its drawbacks.
column2: The phone is a decent phone for the price. However, it does have its drawbacks. The touchscreen is not very responsive - I don't know if it is because of the screen protected (that came with the phone), but sometimes I have to press multiple times before touches are recognized, particularly on the bottom right of the screen where the "back button" is located on most screens. I was expecting the phone to be a bit faster - it takes a noticeable amount of time before apps load. The volume is not very high either, so it can be hard to hear clearly in a noisy environment. Perhaps my biggest complaint is that this comes with the older Android OS (4.2.2) and it doesn't seem like this is going to get an upgrade. And since this doesn't seem to be popular with the developer community, you are unlikely to get custom ROMs for this phone. I like that it came with a protective silicone case and a screen protector.
When trying to text it would not work and majority of the time ill be pushing m and it would be imputing a. all in all defective.

column1: Headphone jack failed after 3 months. Touch screen doesn't work near edges, and camera cannot take up-close photos
column2: Update (July 10th, three months from purchase): The headphone jack no longer recognizes when I plug in headphones / aux port for my car. Music continues to play out of the loudspeaker. ----------------- I've noticed the touch-sensitivity along the edge of this phone does not often work. In order to press an on-screen button, I have to press it multiple times, sometimes mashing my entire finger on the screen in the hopes that it'll detect. An additional problem I have with this phone is the quality of the camera. I enjoy using my phone to remotely deposit bank checks and take up-close photos of documents. However, this phone is unable to do either. It is unable to focus on very close objects, and the resulting images are extremely blurry. I would not recommend this phone for someone who takes up close photographs.

column1: Cheap glitchy phone, perhaps disposable for some
column2: This is definitely not a 4 star phone. Lots of little technical problems add up to make it a pretty mediocre product. The touch screen is not very sensitive and the processing time is pretty slow and very glitchy. I find that I often have to restart the phone. I bought it because I mostly just use google maps, gmail and texting. All other apps I've tried to use on here are pretty slow to function. The camera doesn't switch or activate properly for use in photo apps and pictures come out grainy. I also bought it because I've destroyed a lot of previous phones and I've dropped this one quite a few times now and it's held up nicely. Compared to previous phones I've had around the same price point (LG optimus, Google phones) I would not pick this one. The older LG's and G phones operate better and faster than this newer BLU phone but they are more delicate compared to the BLU (screen cracking, case chipping etc)
This phone is horrible!!! It broke within 10 days!!! There customer service is horrible too! Do not buy, I repeat do not buy!!!

DO NOT buy BLU products. Yes, they're cheap, but you get what you pay for. About a week ago, my phone decided to freak out and have all apps and system functions "unfortunately stop". So I restarted the phone. It froze on start-up, so after removing the battery I restored it to factory settings. After about three hours, any app I tried to open would stop. So I rebooted it. It froze again, and this time took three removals of the battery before it started up again. For the last few days, this happens at least twice a day, and it takes more and more removals of the battery before it starts. I just spent a good ten minutes removing the battery (at least thirty times) to no avail, so I'm putting the SIM card back into my old phone that's horribly cracked and still works better than this piece of sh*t. I'm going to the AT&T store tomorrow to buy a new phone. THIS PHONE IS TWO MONTHS OLD.

column1: The phone sucks. The camera does not work and voice notes ...
column2: The phone sucks. The camera does not work and voice notes are not saved. Almost all media files are damaged . lousy investment

column1: There are better Blu phones out there for less than $100
column2: Hi, My father bought this approximately a year and a half ago. It is an okay phone, but not one that I would purchase again for a family member. Pros Unlocked Budget conscious Comes with free add ons (screen protector, case, head phones) Replaceable battery Watch youtube and play games without issues Cons Small viewing angle Low memory for downloading apps Screen freezes Bulky Last Thoughts If this phone were a bit cheaper then I would think that it was a good value, but I would not recommend this phone to a friend or family member. If you can spare a bit more I would suggest upgrading to the Blu Studio X (white), which is what I use now. The Studio X is better than this phone in every way and still manages to stay under $100. I hope you can find the phone that works within your budget.

column1: Decent, save for the hard-to-see screen
column2: For the price, this phone isn't that bad, but I had to return mine for one issue - the screen isn't visible outside even in shade or in the car. That's a problem. One expects a budget handset to skimp on the screen. However, even if otherwise fully functional, what good does it do if you can't see it? If you'll only ever use it in lower light settings, here's what you'll get: A fully functional android phone without bloatware with a decent battery and is responsive to simple tasks, but inadequate for gaming and the like. The screen is visible only straight on. Call quality is okay. Camera is below average. Storage is expandable via microsd card. The phone can accept two sim cards - regular and micro - so it makes an ideal first foray into a smartphone if you're coming off a bar or flip phone of old. You know... If you can see it...

This phone was small but surprisingly durable for a long time. It comes with a small case that protected the sides and the screen only broke once I dropped on asphalt without it's case on. My only problem was that the battery started swelling up and I could no longer even put the back on the phone. Upon reading up on it, this could be very dangerous and even by replacing the battery it could potentially happen again and catch fire. The phone began to get really hot while it was charging. After some time the battery wouldn't even fit in the phone and I was forced to replace it. The phone itself lasted about nine months for me, which was actually a significant amount since I always seem to break them early. For the price it's definitely a deal, but the swelling battery was a huge turn off and I'd rather my pocket didn't catch fire, even for a hundred dollars less.

I rally debated the number of stars for this. I mean, it's a fairly cheap phone, so one should expect it to be less than perfect. I bought this to replace a Nokia, which I didn't like because it kept shutting down on me and because it was a Microsoft platform and, I mean, really? I wanted an Android and I couldn't see spending hundreds of dollars. It's an okay phone that I'd probably give 3 or 4 stars for if it weren't for the keyboard. It is total, utter crap. I'm constantly mistyping and hitting that stupid emoticon button on the bottom right. You kind of have to hit the keys slightly off center in order to MAYBE type what you want. The voice dictation works very well, but often you aren't somewhere where you (or at least I) want others to hear my messages. On the plus side, it's cheap and it charges very quickly.

column1: THE EQUIPMENT TO THE PERFORMANCE IS A GOOD TEAM, BUT HAS A DETAIL TO MAKE THE ...
column2: THE EQUIPMENT TO THE PERFORMANCE IS A GOOD TEAM, BUT HAS A DETAIL TO MAKE THE CALL THAT CREATES NO NOISE HEARD ME.

column1: It is nothing like our Fire Phone for sure
column2: Just got this phone around 10:00 this morning. I purchased it for my 12 year old. The slowness of this phone is rediculous. Something I would expect from an android that came out 5 years ago. It is nothing like our Fire Phone for sure. It has literally taken me ALL DAY to download just the Facebook app and now been trying for over an hour to download the FB Messenger. And now that FB is downloaded, it takes forever when you open it just for the screen to refresh & see the posts. If her other phone didn't break, this phone would be in the box on the way back to Amazon today! Not only that, but i fully charged it about 2 hours ago and it's already down to 75%. I don't know that I even want to subject my daughter to this. Just to hear the crying over the aggravation I don't think will be worth it!! LOL... :-(

I originally brought this phone around Christmas and thought "hey, I deserve a good new phone" I'm aware the cost was low but hey there were so many good reviews "how could I go wrong" said stupid past me. I was very wrong. The phone has a terribly regrettable reflective screen and often has trouble keeping a solid wifi connection. But he's the kicker. Stupid past Me didn't heed another reviewers warning of this being a defective phone and I truly wish I had now. Upon usage five months after purchasing I suddenly get a strange error message. I turn off the phone to reset and when I restarted it was stuck at the loading screen. With a bit of research it turns out its a major and irreversible defect with the Blu phone series. And sadly that its...don't buy this phone. Don't make the mistake i made.
.Rear camera is not good at all. Pictures are not clear . Battery does not hold a charge for any length of time
Very slow touch screen, gps take forever to work, apps work very slow, do not recommend this device to anyone.

It was very good when I got it! Still think that is good enough but after a while I realised that 3G wasn't working (Only Edge/Gprs) and some programs like the browser and Play Store were crashing! Think well before buying this phone anyways! I Clear the Cache when I want to use the play store again, I have the browser crashing only when I want to type some url but I solved it by using Google.com (Browser's default home page) I mean when I want to go to facebook I just type facebook on the google search box and click it in the search results! Anyways this phone doesn't lag or freeze and that's a good one. Back camera is good enough, front camera isn't that much but I still use it for Skype conversations in high light rooms! Low front speaker volume during a phone call.

column1: I have had this since November of 2014 and have waited to really find out ow good the product is
column2: Pros: Cheap. I have had this since November of 2014 and have waited to really find out ow good the product is. I needed four unlocked phones I needed in a hurry. Cons: 1. Poor touch sensitivity 2. Gyro practically nonfunctional 3. Poor quality camera and the front camera plastic cover went opaque within a few months (so, no selfies :(). 4. I had some technical issues and could not contact the customer service. 5. Of the four phomes I bought, only one is capable of catching any wifi signal, the other three refuses to connect to any available wifi. They have a phone number which never gets answered (tried at least 10 times if not more) and they don't bother to respond to your email. Suggest stay away from this product if you want a decent smart phone.

column1: This phone is not good i bought 2 of them and the battery is ...
column2: This phone is not good i bought 2 of them and the battery is dead without even using them they are useless
Piece of crap phone, also only gets 3g. Super slow for everything, programs and games basically won't run.

column1: Will have to return the phone.
column2: I currently have the Net10 $15/month auto refill program with my phone. This phone will not work with that - you will have to pay for $40/month unlimited service. I contacted TracFone also, and was told they do not support phones with a SIM card. "Mariam: Does the phone use a SIM card? Lois: Yes. And it is unlocked. Mariam: One moment please... Mariam: Unfortunately, we do not support phones that use a SIM card. Mariam: You will not be able to use your phone with us. And with that she ended the chat session! Buyer Beware! I will be returning this phone. Disappointed, because I really liked the phone and its features!So much for the "Bring Your Own Phone" program!

column1: Doesn't Suit My Needs, I Expected Too Much
column2: If you're like me, and use your phone for tons of things, this isn't the phone for you. Usable storage space is 1.3 GB. And you get maybe half of that after all the built-in apps. I've downloaded seven apps, apps that I consider necessities, and I can't update any of them, because even though there's still 200 MB of storage left, the phone feels there isn't enough space to update them. It's also a bit slow, but that's to be expected with the price. I know that you get what you pay for, and in this case, I didn't pay for enough. If you need a budget phone, and don't rely on it too much, go ahead and order it, it should fit your needs perfectly. If you like having games and apps to get things done, move on and find something else.

column1: This is a no for me
column2: Battery no good. Didon't charge up overnight. Seemed cheaply made. Not impressed. Sent it right back

column1: based on the other very good reviews. You get what you paid for
column2: I bought two of it, one for myself, the other for my dad, based on the other very good reviews. You get what you paid for...actually I could and would have got a much better one with a little bit more money if I have time to try it first. This phone is at least 3-4 years outdated. The screen is terrible. I can't see anything under sun or at an angle. One of the two batteries lasts less than a day with almost no use. Somehow I can't connect it to computer to upload the pictures. And it starts giving this loud ring when nothing comes up in the middle of night--still need to figure out how to turn the sound off, which isn't too obvious. Good thing about it...it is indeed unlocked, and it can display many languages.

Well.... I wanted to like the phone; my first Android. I bought it after research here on Amazon to use on a 6 month transfer to the UK. Confirmed that it is unlocked... just like the name says. UI and layout are good, and I loaded p the SIM card with a bunch of useful apps from my home wireless. When I got to the UK and popped in a major name SIM chip, the warm and fuzzy started to wear off... As it turns out there is 'Unlocked' and then truly unlocked. I cannot get a cellular data connection here in the UK with numerous SIM chips and trips to the major mobile phone shops (Voda, O2....) Wireless connections are no problem, ; cell phone and text are OK, thus the 3 stars. So it is half a doorstop while I am here.

column1: Dropped Calls in both Sim Cards.
column2: The product has faulty software. Dropped calls after 20 to 30 seconds of making or receiving calls.

After one week of owning this phone I am encountering potentially fatal flaws. Twice I have had to resort to a reboot because on the first occasion the keypad failed to appear when I needed it. The phone displayed a message saying it was having problems connecting to player services. On the second occasion, while using whatsapp it just froze and the newly received message could not be opened. However, earlier today, I became aware that Google Play Store just would not load. I keep getting a message saying "error retrieving information from server [ DF-DFERH-01]" I am beginning to feel this phone was rushed through production/assembly and is mediocre quality. And that is a waste of hard earned money!
the picture quality is poor. the phone randomly changes screens and frequently disconnects calls.

column1: ... Even with speakerphones the call quality is all but useless in crowded place like a park or theater
column2: The phone does not work without the speakerphone (the sound is basically inaudible and I have very sensitive ears) Even with speakerphones the call quality is all but useless in crowded place like a park or theater. Miscellaneous other bugs (such as cannot send SMS from the secondary SIM) completes the feature list. On the PROs, the dual SIM is helpful for those who wear two hats (like me) and do not want to carry two phones. Application software upgrade also works, although I could not get the system software to upgrade. However, I'm sure there are better dual SIM Android phones out there; don't waste your money on this as it is all but unusable.

Saw all the reviews, was so excited. Bought as temporary, but it was performing so well, I started thinking I could use it for as long as it worked. Worked fine for a few weeks, and I was still really happy with it, and then it began to freeze and refused to react to powering off unless I manually took the battery out, and then it'd restart over and over until it ran out of battery. Phones in today's world can be someone's whole life, and while I really only needed it for calls and messages, it got to a point where I couldn't even do those things. I can't believe the amount of problems it started to show-- it literally went from 100 to 0 functionality in less than a month.

I ended up returning this phone because i disliked it so much. Amazon issued me a full refund minus the cost of shipping. At first it seemed like a decent phone for the price, but there were 3 issues that just drove me crazy after about a week of use: 1) The screen has a very limited viewing angle. If you tilt it even slightly, you can't see what's on the screen anymore. 2) The camera is of poor quality. Even with the flash on and at the highest resolution setting, pictures were grainy and often out of focus. 3) The screen freezes and distorts when using simple apps (Facebook messenger, for instance, almost always locked up when i would use it).
I got these phones for relatives in jamaica and it stopped working it chips out and chips in

column1: Don't waste your money with this device
column2: The phone worked only for two months and then died. Don't waste your money with this device.

column1: Neither camera quality is not even good enough for taking pictures of checks for banking apps
column2: Bought this as a replacement for the $50-60 Nokia 520 that has been out for several years...much lower quality somehow and for an even higher price! Neither camera quality is not even good enough for taking pictures of checks for banking apps. Using the front facing camera feels like I'm back in the early 2000s with a 1mp camera. Screen is hard to view from any angle more than like 20 degrees off facing the screen directly. Touch screen is older type, not very sensitive. Would not recommend this phone, although a friend has a more expensive BLU model phone and seems to like it. Just steer clear of this phone unless you have no other choice.
What a waste!!!! Can't send or receive picture texts. Sent it back!!! Very disappointed.

column1: the manual included with the phone is the size of a matchbook and useless.
column2: the device is functional and reliable. the company email and phone support is seriously lacking. my first two phone calls resulted in holds of 18 and 35 minutes; after which I disconnected. turning to email I sent three. the first went unanswered. I resent an email after 4 working days, and received a reply after 5 more working days. the reply seemed to be a "cut and paste" job and ignored two of the three questions I asked. I sent a follow up to this reply and received an email response 9 days later- (that is not an exaggeration or typo). ps: the manual included with the phone is the size of a matchbook and useless.

column1: A game player, recorder, camera - just get a good SD Card to go with it.
column2: I admittedly don't use this as a phone, or a text sender. I use it to play games. And for that purpose, this is generally a good phone for the price. It plays games pretty well - especially those that don't require bloatware like Google Play or Amazon.Mind you, I can't give it good marks because I bought and added a 16 GB SD Card, and that has probably alleviated a lot of the issues others complain about. More space = faster phone. It is decent at recording film and taking pictures. Don't take closeup shots with it - it only has the quality of a mid-90s camcorder. But for casual picture taking and film recording it is good.

BUYER BEWARE!!!!! I actually do like the phone, however......the manufacturer "BLU" does not stand behind their product. My phone did fine for 3 mths. The SD card bracket detached on 1 side from the phone, releasing the card to be loose in the phone and in the process it was fried, could not retrieve anything from the card. I contacted the manufacturer and was told it was not warranty. It was "PHYSICAL DAMAGE". The phone still works thankfully, but I still feel I've wasted my money as it is still "broken", can not be used to it full potential. I will not be purchasing or recommending Blu to anyone.

column1: Cheap, adequate but wonky: Five Star Price - Two Star Performance
column2: For the price, this is a great smartphone. Its no Galaxy. It definitely is not as nice as an iPhone. I get numerous complaints about my sound quality during phone calls. The keypad is difficult to accurately use during texting. So-so battery life. Can't get my T-mobile voice mail to work on this phone (could be me, could be the phone). The display is a little weird in landscape orientation. It came with a thin, rubber case and a screen protector which is cool. As a smart phone, it works adequately. If I dropped it in the pool, I would buy a different phone. I am looking forward to replacing it with an iPhone again.

The first unit I ordered was defective as the calls were getting cut off within 2-3 seconds When I called BLU customer service they requested me to do a HARD RESET and sent the instructions to do so and walked me through it Still didn't work -I returned this unit and asked for a replacement SAME PROBLEM Am returning it also I saw that there were about 75 bad reviews on this model However I purchased the BLU 4.5 NEO and that works perfectly I think you should stop selling the 4.0 as there is obviously a problem with that model Philip Jayawardena

I can't even express how much I dislike this phone. The keyboard is difficult to type on, the screen is overly sensitive when scrolling on the internet, the apps available are minimal, the inherent browser is annoying (only 6ish windows are allowed and it closes old ones randomly, when you hit back if you're on the first page, it will close the window, there is no forward button), the inherent mail option only allows one mailbox, so you have to have multiple mail icons to manage different mailboxes, etc. All in all I found it non-intuitive and usually frustrating. Spend a little more and get an android.

***UPDATE*** So, I loved this phone when I first got it. It seemed fairly easy to use and I learned more and more about it each day for awhile. Then, just over 90 days in, AFTER the warranty expired, it started acting up. It would turn itself off, it would lock up, it wouldn't send text, it wouldn't load the internet. I had to reboot it many times because the screen would lock up, I couldn't make calls, or it wasn't receiving text messages- even ones that my husband sent me from his phone, sitting next to me, on the same carrier and plan as me (family account). Then, on March 5, 2015, it completed stopped working. System UI stopped, Bluetooth stopped. This phone had an almost perfect screen, a few smudge scratches, but regular 'wear and tear' you could expect from someone who uses it mainly as a safety device. (so my disabled parent would be able to reach me at ANY time) It was in my pocket maybe 2 hours a day, the remainder of each day it was on a desk/nightstand. March 6, 2015, we took it to an AT&T store hoping that they could at least transfer the data on it to a new phone, BUT it would no longer even boot up. I thought maybe I needed to fully charge it, remove the battery, etc- but no- it just completely crashed, it would flicker a light on, then turn right off, ONCE, then did nothing. It completely died- not even one year after purchase. And My husband's Nokia Lumia 520, which I bought the same day, hasn't had even one problem. The man at the AT&T store asked what kind of phone it was before I had handed it to him, and as soon as I said Blu, I got an 'oh, one of those'. Even they know the brand, not for its 'greatness'. So, feel free to waste your money like I did, thinking you would get a steal, or for 50$ you can get a Windows Phone, Nokia Lumia that actually works. _______________________________________________ My first "smarter than user" phone and liking it so far... Only wish it came with more thorough operating instructions as I am very new to the smart phone world and it is kicking my butt so far! Easy to operate the majority of the functions and comes with the nice Google play store so you can easily download many apps, etc. Great choice for a first timer or experienced smart phone user. Does NOT come with a sim card and has the option of using two at once- be sure to get a sim card ahead of time as this phone has a larger one then in comparable sized phones like the Nokia Lumia's.

I ordered this item in November 2014. The features are great and it worked well with the dual sims - at first. By February 2015, the handset begins to freeze up and won't move beyond the boot screen - even after I removed the sim cards as well as the memory card. I bought this handset for my daughter for her birthday and she barely had 3 months use of it. I have since tried to return it for an exchange but is unable to do so because it is now out of the returns window. This is a major disappointment and makes me very reluctant to make any further electronic purchase through Amazon.
It says Unlocked, but actually it is locked phone and can't be used in overseas.

column1: It does not work with my SD Card, neither my Sim Card.
column2: I love the phone. Yes, It arrived earlier than expected, thanks. It came new, in bundle including: headphone, charger & adapter, case, screen protector and well packaged. But the only problems right now are: It's not working with my memory cards, I have tried both 1Gb & 16Gb, it just wouldn't play my music, says its empty or no music. Why? If it doesn't play with my memory card and worja with my sim card-( I have a simple mobile simcard and a Lycamobile sum card), then I'll definite key have to return it. If it does works with everything, then I'll give a 5-Star later. Thank you!!!

column1: also something is not good with the camera it looks green and when I ...
column2: Hello, I'm Vianneth Camargo. I'm writing you to report that the cellphone mobile BLU Advance 4.0, I bought on febrary, It does not work, It present so many problems, the screen turns white and when it turn off, also something is not good with the camera it looks green and when I try to take a picture, the picture is also green. I appreciate and be glad if you answer to me what you can do to fix the problem with my order because I'm from Venezuela, a friend did to me the favor of bring me the cellphone. and she arrived just two days ago. thanks so much.. I'm waiting an answer.

This phone sucked. Had to get a replacement for first one they sent because screen was defective, then got the second one and right away trouble began. Dropped calls, slow screen, wouldn't hold charge. I understand it's a $50 phone so I didn't expect much, but I expected it to work as a phone. I had a blu studio 5.5 before and that was a great phone actually (totally recommend!) so I wasn't worried about this one but it's been such a hassle and disappointment. I wanted my money back but its been over 30 days.... :(. Overall, don't waste your time or money.

column1: I was in the hospital for almost 3 weeks, ...
column2: I was in the hospital for almost 3 weeks, when I at was an impressive phonegot out I tried to log into my phone, I used log in numbers that I use for banking, a few other codes I tried also, the phobe did not recognize any codes and now it is locked down. ATT advised they cannot fix the phone that I must contact Amazon which is a chore to do, Now Im out of the hospitall as of yesterday, still disable and need to make contact with the outside world, There is nothing in the booklet provided, nor any help on the community, so now i, stuck with wh

column1: It came in a nicely neat box
column2: I bought it for my son... but it hasn't worked at all since. Don't buy it.. don't purchase it... It came in a nicely neat box. I got the cell, battery, earphones, usb cable, charger, protective film, and instructions... still don't recomend. I have visited several cell repairs shops and it doesn't have any solution. the return policy expires and I have a broken cell... the main problem is that it frozen the main welcome screen (ither the white or the three colored one)... can't reset 'cos it doesn't have that function active. Don't buy.
This phone gets the job done but......I don't think I would buy it again.
had to send it back was dropping calls every two minutes.unhappy with it.

column1: The biggest disappointment is the audio jack is NOT a 3
column2: The phone works well enough. The screen is a bit hard to see but is okay. The camera is less than, but it works. The biggest disappointment is the audio jack is NOT a 3.5 as advertised it is a 2.5 and the headset that came with the phone only lasted a couple of weeks. I have been unable to find a replacement headset that will work with the phone for audio in and out due to the 2.5 jack in the phone. All the 2.5 to 3.5 adapters I have found only will do audio out. That does not work so much for talking on the phone. :-(

Phone look good and APPs worked fine but the phone does not connect to the internet of the carrier. Contacted AT&T to configured internet APN settings over the phone, had a hard time finding the APN settings could not do it was told to go to a AT&T store to see if they can do it for me. ones we found the APN settings, AT&T person tried several times saving the APN settings, phone keeps returning to default settings. Had to buy a new one and sign a new contract which I did not want. I returned the phone to get money back.

I got his phone a year ago as a replacement for my ATT Avail. The phone worked fine until a couple days ago when a portion of the touch screen stopped working. For less then $100 and considering I work in a harsh environment (dust, heat, metal shavings, etc. ) and always have the phone in my pocket that's pretty good. Only issues I had prior to the screen were that the GPS was really spotty, and the camera is doesn't focus very well, which would cause me to have to take 20 pictures of something to get one decent one.

Phone died in 5 months, I get the dreaded resting android robot with "no command" after suffering with the BLU loading screen logo for a couple of days. I really regret this purchase, specially because of the terrible camera, everything else seemed fine. Before the system died I was experiencing issues with super slow response and apps shutting off or things randomly getting out of place while in normal use. :( I contacted blu today about it, I hope for an answer and a solution for this problem.

column1: Not all it's hyped up to be.
column2: I purchased this phone for my daughter's birthday. The first phone I got, the door for the SD card slot broke off when we tried to open it so I sent for a replacement. We got the second phone. In spite of the phone being up-to-date, whenever she would take pictures and try to send them the phone would shut down. When she tried send text messages on the first day she got it, it shut down on her. I returned the phone and got a Samsung Galaxy Light which she has had for about a week now and is thrilled with it.
Screen not that clear.. But overall works well with tmobile network..

column1: I do not recommend anyone buy
column2: The phone did not work even a week. I do not recommend anyone buy !!!

Please think before ordering any product from the BLU company. I purchased this phone and within a week I had to reset it multiple times and the SD card holder completely broke off. I had previously ordered the 5.0 version and loaned it to a friend. It worked for five weeks then shut down and will not even power on. I was extra disappointed when I realized the 5.0 was past the date for return. So I lost 80 dollars on a phone that is useless after a few weeks. I will never order from this cell provider again.

column1: Not worth it; freezes up. Second Blu phone we've been through.
column2: Bought this for Christmas last year for my wife; It didn't make it 5 months before it started freezing up. This is the second Blu phone we've been through that didn't last more than 5 months. It's not worth the money; the phones were never dropped or damaged in any way. They both froze constantly to where you had to remove the battery completely to get it work again. It couldn't handle many apps; it would automatically get hot and go back to the home screen. Save your money and get something better.

column1: This is a pretty good phone for its price
column2: This is a pretty good phone for its price. The signal and call quality are good. It can be used with no-contract GSM providers in the US and internationally. However, after some casual usage, its obvious that you'd want a better phone if you can afford it. The TFT screen just looks awful when you've gotten used to better alternatives. Also, the UI still has lots of mysterious bugs. My phone icons often got lost or moved trying to answer the phone. 3 months later, its now my son's mp3 player.

If it wasn't for the viewing angle issue where it is hard to even look at the screen without going cross eyed, it would be a great phone. You have to tilt the phone about 30 degrees in a certain direction to see it clearly. It's like going back 15 years to the first flat screen monitors where you have to look at it perfectly or it looks like a negative image. I know how a phone should look because I had a HTC G2 and I never had this issue before. That phone is like 5 years older than this one! One other thing, if I close one eye and compare what I see when I close the other eye, I see 2 different renderings of the same image. So, you have 2 different views in each eye and it isn't pleasant when trying to look at it with both eyes.
battery not functioning properly discharged in less than two hours

You definetly get what you pay for. It definetly not a phone you want to have long term. I have had this phone for about 2 months now and I can say it is already malfuctioning quite a bit. Bluetooth is very wonky with this phone and tends to not work. It slows down very frequently, even when you are just writing a text. It seems like the phone cannot handle regular use. I would only reccomend if this is your last option (it shouldn't be). There are other better options, keep looking.

THe phone works great!!! The problem is this. The phone its self only has 4gb of on board memory and no matter what I try, once that memory is full, I cannot down load anything as I get an error message stating there inst enough space. Pictures and video work fine as i have a micro sim in the phone, but when trying to point the default down load to the removable Sim, it just gives me the same error about lack of space. I have 3 blu phones and this is the case with all of them.

What an absolute WASTE of my money. This product was bought for the purpose of functionality abroad but it has done nothing but give me problems. First, the phone freezes or is unresponsive while trying to interact with apps. Second, the clock lost its functionality after 3 months of use. Lastly, I just woke up one day and the phone decided that it was going to turn on but not boot the operating system. I have no problem saying that this was the worst purchase of my life.

column1: Buy phones directly from your carrier.
column2: It is suppose to work with Consumer Cellular (CC). I spent a few hours on the phone with the folks at CC and despite their efforts was not able to get this thing to work with 4G. It works a cell phone but doesn't even do a good job with that. I was hoping to find a link to their customer support on Amazon but didn't. I ended up spending $30 more ($100) and getting a Motorola phone from CC and now have 4G. I am using the BLU phone on my desk to hold papers.

column1: Bad camera, REALLY bad brightness I can't stress it ...
column2: It's okay. You get what you pay for. If your daily phone broke and you needed a temporary phone then yes this phone will due till then but it's not something you would want to stay with. Bad camera, REALLY bad brightness I can't stress it enuff that if they would have turned up the brightness it would be a better phone but it's so bad you can't even use outside, and the sound is bad too I mean you can beraly hear but like I said you get what you pay for

Ordered and received 3. First one had to be returned right off the bat due to a hum during phone calls. Second of the 3 was hanging up on calls which appears to be due to the sensor not turning of the key pad when held to the face. Waiting for the 1st requested return to be delivered today, and to hear back from Amazon for approval on the second request. The 3rd phone appears to be working so far. Hoping to not have to return that one too. What a pain.

column1: It broke right away (but after I could return it)
column2: It broke 1 month after I bought it. Now it does not turn on.

It only lasted two weeks , now the screen won't come on , try the reboot procedure by removing the battery and replacing it again , and then pushing the volume down and power at the same time , the screen comes to "factory mode " , choose " reboot" but nothing happens . This is my fierst smart phone , and I'm in Brazil , so returning the damn thing is out of the question . Put some more money and buy something else .

I picked this up for $50, so can't complain too much. (It's helping with a transition.). Still, with data and wifi on, the battery time is terrible: less than 10 hours standby time with very little actual use (so you MUST leave it charging overnight or it will have almost no charge in the morning). Somehow, It hangs up on people often. The processor is slow. There is little memory. And occasionally, the screen just doesn't show anything even though the phone is on (can't even just turn it off ndo on then--have to take the battery out to get it to work right again). For all of that, it basically works. So, if you want a low end smart(ish) phone, fine. But if you want a good smart phone, look elsewhere.

column1: keep it moving folks, nothing to see here
column2: Ordered this phone in Dec 2014 and it will not turn on at all now. Just quit right out of the blue. I bought a new battery thinking maybe that would solve the problem but was no help. So I check out the site here and see it has a 1 year warranty and then sent BLU an email explaining situation and asking how to have warranty work or replacement done. NO REPLY! It was a pretty good phone till it quit. So no I really can not recommend it.
Camera quality is not good! Just a smart phone that is all

column1: Nice Phone That Works Great... Until It Suddenly Doesn't And Then You're All Out Of Luck
column2: After six weeks of normal use, it got stuck in a boot loop. The BLU symbol is stuck on screen whenever I reboot and won't go off. A factory reset/cache wipe didn't help. Amazon's exchange policy doesn't cover it since it's been more than 30 days. So I guess I'm going to hope flashing the ROM works. But if you want a phone that works, buy something else.
Overpriced! Extremely low quality screen! Does the job :/

Nice phone, internet seems ok, calling ok, screen ok. 2nd day I was using the phone the call were not dropped but audio dropped out while using bluetooth feature in my Volvo. Shortly after that incident while walking the audio dropped off while call remained connected. Seemed like a problem with the phone so it was returned. The features that attracted me were dual sim cards, factory unlocked and the super low price.

column1: Mine is still working fine but i would not recommend
column2: Bought one for me one for my girlfriend, in general the phone works okay, a little slow but functional as long as your phone is not your life. After about 3 months my girlfriends phone complete crapped out on her for no reason, it was well taken care of and it no longer turns on. Mine is still working fine but i would not recommend. I feel like a second hand droid or iphone would be more reliable than this.
Is good for the price, but camera quality is too poor

column1: it's not like I'm expert con this issue
column2: It's my third smartphone or so, it's not like I'm expert con this issue. But I have this since 3 weeks and this blu do what is meant for. One thing I dislike is the screen. If you don't have it straight in front of your eyes the view distorts. It's good for stranger sneaky glares, but still feels a bit uncomfy. Software is very friendly. I think blu 4.0 is perfecto to be your first smartphone.

I have had this phone for about a month and am now sending it back. The audio port has completely stopped working and will only sense headphones if A LOT of pressure is used to continuously push the headphones into the phone. The screen is not great quality and becomes very dark when looked at from one side. However, this phone is a very cheap choice so for the price, it is not a bad phone.

This phone is good. I had it for a year now and it's fine. The front camera sucks, but the back camera is great. It picks up good reception. It does have a micro SD slot,but it's hard to get a SD card in. The screen is finger print magnet and the keyboard is slow. The internet is really fast and I was surprised. The phone comes with a free case and screen protector which is nice.

column1: good and bad wish i could rate it better
column2: The phone is great. Best phone I've ever owned. The only probably are The cameras the the back camera when you use the flash it barely works and if its not dark just dim you can nearly see. The front camera is terrible all around has to be really bright where ever you are for the camera to see you and its awful quality, the quality is so bad you might as well not have a front camera
I received this camera and the flash is not working

Phone seems to work well. My wife and I bought the same phone and hers has acted a little buggy - it froze up and wouldn't start up again, even with Recovery mode instructions and such. Then a day later it started. Then it went down again. Now its up and working. I hope it continues working. My own phone has worked well so far. Battery lasts up to two days - not too shabby.

column1: do not buy this if you want a phone longer than a year
column2: looks nice, feels nice....but is junk. Randomly shuts down, will not open some text messages, says data is at capacity basically out of the box. no option to move bulk of data to sd card. the dual sim card option is awesome, but we are 4 months in and have to replace it already. This was our 3rd and final blu product as the other 2 did not last more than 10 months.

column1: Great phone if you don't want to talk to anyone for more than 45 seconds.
column2: Bought this for my daughter. It was buggy from the start. It has nice design, good screen and two sim slots, but you couldn't hold a conversation of longer than 45 seconds without the call dropping. Maybe we got a lemon, but it really deserves O stars because it was not fit for the intended purpose. Returned it and got a Samsung for cheap at Fry's and it has worked great.

Not a happy camper..I brought this phone for my mom I thought I was getting a good deal with this purchase since the product arrived on time and in good condition. The phone worked fine for two days, and in the third day, it started to display horrible lines on the screen, making the phone difficult to use. Now I have to get a replacement, Hope this one will work better.
Was dead on arrival but I received reimbursement.

I bought 2 phones. It seems to be almost impossible to send pictures through text. The phone also calls people when we aren't wanting to...this even overrides out lockout codes.... One of the phones is continually freezing up and has be reset---this happens quite often. I wish we would have spent the money and bought different phones. We are really disappointed.

Put in my AT&T SIM. It saw the SIM and I thought that it would work but it refuses to see the network for voice call. Nothing will change it's little mind on this. It's useless. I finally became mad enough to slam it against the brick fence in my backyard (after removing the SIM). I'll stick with my old Motorola clam shell from now on. No sissy smart phones for me.

column1: Freezes up and Blu customer service is terrible.
column2: I bought this phone for my husband. It is terrible. It freezes up all of the time. The customer service for Blu is awful. I was on hold for 6 hours just to get through to an actual person! After making multiple calls and being put on hold again and again I finally got sent another phone just for it to do the same thing. Will never buy this phone again.

This phone is complete s***. After six months of use, I am incapable of using it. At all! I got the phone returned and I got a new one, but lucky was able to keep the old one at no extra cost, and I was SO lucky. Because the new one died after six months, and I had to go back to the one with the broken ear bud jack. It is worthless, and should not be bought.

column1: Don't waste your money buying this crap
column2: Don't waste your money buying this crap! I had it for about 3 months. It got stuck on the start up screen and would not budge, so i got a technician to do an some kind of update. It worked about 2 1/2 weeks and now same crap happens. Nobody can fix it. Blu customer support is a waste of time. Best advise=======>DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! NOT WORTH IT!!
The worst camera ever, but battery is very good
Stoped working in less than a month. DO NOT BUY

column1: I bought 2 cell phones BLU Advance 4. 0 ...
column2: I bought 2 cell phones BLU Advance 4.0 Unlocked Dual... and after I received the units, in 6 weeks one of them appeared totally death, even with battery full; then the second one is death after 10 days since the first one. The units just show the black and white screen with the word name "blu" and thats all. Is frustrating and wasting of money.

column1: While the phone itself worked great, don't believe everyone who says it works with ...
column2: While the phone itself worked great, don't believe everyone who says it works with straight talk. I spent another $20 on sim cards trying to get it to function in my area, and eventually found out it could not. So now I've essentially got a very inexpensive ipod touch. Your service area with ST may not be compatible with this phone, so bear that in mind.

I wanted this to work. I was impressed with a U.S. company was making a budget phone and really wanted it to work so very much. But we had so many issues with the phone. Within two weeks it was virtually useless. Sadly we returned the phone. We had most of the problems already described concerning this phone. I would love to buy a U.S. made phone.

It's good for a cheap replacement, but other than that it's horrible. It force quits on everything. This phone can't handle much at all. If it can't handle even the simplest of tasks or apps, why even make them available? I have to type slower because it can't keep up. I downloaded SwiftKey, which helps a little but still doesn't work like I want it to.

column1: Very disappointed with this phone, defective or bad quality? I don't know!
column2: I an not sure if the item I received was defective or actually very poor quality, but I didn't like it at all. When you look at the LCD from a normal angel picture and color were distorted, you had to angel it in a certain way to be able to see a clear picture with normal color. Made it really hard to take pictures because you couldn't see the screen.

column1: The Samsung works great, has all the same features
column2: You get what you pay for! The blue tooth would not sync up with my 2013 Hyundai Sonata. None of my other phones had this problem. The display had to be viewed at just the right angle, especially when watching videos; otherwise it would appear too dark to see any detail. Also, after setting up the mobile network by creating a new APN, it kept changing back to the default APN, which is not even associated with my wireless carrier. I had to manually change it back to the new APN whenever I wanted to get internet or use apps. There was no way to delete the original APN's that were installed. I returned it and got the Samsung Galaxy S Duos II S7582 White DUAL SIM Factory Unlocked International Ver for about $40 more. If you do a comparison, you will see that these two phones are very similar. The Samsung works great(none of the above problems), has all the same features, and I am very happy with it.
Nice phone. Can do without the humming sound.

Do yourself a huge favor and spend a little more to get the Moto G. It is so much better in so many ways. First the Moto G has a MUCH better screen. The Advance 4.0 has a screen that only looks decent if you look at it straight on. If you tilt the phone the image will wash away. You will not want to browse the web or do anything that involves using the screen often because you will hate to look at it. Second, the speakerphone works only so so. You will not want to use it because the sound is so muffled and low. Third, because the screen is so cheap it attracts fingerprints like crazy so you will be cleaning it very often. And finally, the battery life on this phone is horrible. I turned off Wi-Fi, disabled all services and email, turned off blue tooth, disabled 3G and even installed the Battery Doctor App and put my phone to sleep at 100% charge. After 2 days of doing nothing but sleeping the phone was down to only 18%! That is atrocious considering they say the phone should last far longer in idle mode. Finally, there are no plans to ever update this phone to KitKat. The CEO of BLU basically said that if you want a more advanced OS then go and get a better phone. When I emailed BLU they just gave me a canned response. It appears that BLU is more concerned about releasing new phones (They have like 36 different phones!) rather than supporting and updating the phones that people already use. Spend a little more and get the Moto G or even the Moto E and you will be soooo much happier. And both the Moto G and the Moto E come with the latest version of KitKat out of the box!

column1: The phone did not deliver the quality it was promised.
column2: Initially the home button wasn't working. After factory resetting multiple times it finally worked. The front camera doesn't work, the phone screen has problems, after few minutes of use the screen is causing eyes to be strained and headaches. My teenage son is not able to use this phone because of these problems. I tried to use the phone with same experience.

column1: blu unlocked dual sim phone is dropping phone calls
column2: Dear seller, I could not find your email. I received blu Advance 4.0 Unlocked Dual Sim phone from you on 06/19/14. I purchased it on 06/11/14. When it is arrived on 06/19/14 I went to the cell phone service and the phone was working right. I use white phone. Couple days ago I was talking to my friend and your phone dropped the phone calls 3 times within 5 minutes. Today BLU Advance 4.0 Unlocked Dual SIM phone dropped 5 phone calls within 3 minutes. I think there is something wrong with your phone. Could you, please, send me another one to change? Thank you, Tatsiana Seibel.

This phone is the right size and has the features that I need without the fluff. Unfortunately, I cannot access the Internet except through Wi-Fi. I even took the phone to my service provider, who verified all settings to ensure the 3G was enabled. It was. So, they thought maybe the sim card was the problem since it was transferred straight from my old device into this phone. Nope, even a new card didn't make a difference, and a second technician verified the settings. And then on top of that, the lower "buttons" (Menu, Home, & Return) starting flashing intermittently today for no reason. My service provider believes the phone is faulty. I still need to contact the company and seller, so hopefully an exchange goes quickly and smoothly.

column1: nice feature phone but screen is very poor
column2: Great priced android phone but note that the screen resolution is bad. you will have to tilt back and forth to get decent view of screen. not recommended

column1: I waited to long to return this really useless item. I can not make ANY PHONE calls ...
column2: I waited to long to return this really useless item. I can not make ANY PHONE calls with out hanging up on the person while talking, loseing the phone keypad or some other nonsensense. The age old adage you get what you pay for is completely true here. Oh wait you can text with it and read emails, thats a plus... I would not recommend this phone.

column1: Great phone, excellent dual SIM system, some shortcomings
column2: Products looks and feels great. Came with extra protective case and screen protector. I like that you can switch between which of your SIM should be the main one, i.e. the one with 3G (the secondary one has 2G as in most dual SIM phones). Unfortunately the display does not dim automatically, and is a bit thick. Thus only 3 stars.

column1: I am very shocked and disappointed the product
column2: I bought by this means two cell phones BLU ADVANCE 4.0 to give them to my children. The first two weeks both cell worked perfectly , really these phones have all the functions that my children need . After two weeks left turning on both phones , even though they were fully loaded ... I am very shocked and disappointed the product. !

column1: BLU Phone- Infant Mortality Failure, Poor Quality Device
column2: I bought the phone Feb 19 almost 1.5 months ago and now it doesn't even work. The screen comes ON but is blank White, I can hear it powering up but no display. I mean come on, paying for a smartphone that only works 2 months is plain ridiculous!! I don't think this is an isolated case since I see other people having similar issues less than 90 day failure issues. By the way the phone has never been damaged or handled in a improper manner.

Very short battery life. Drops calls constantly. No photo match to phone numbers in contacts and you can't edit or delete contacts. Very unhappy and returning it. Thank God I bought through Amazon because the company not only offers no warranty...but they won't take their crap back either. Extremely unhappy. You get what you pay for.

for starters the camera is absolutely terrible on this phone! second the sound well volume when you are on the phone is very low! third the screen went black on me when I went to unlock it and then I turned it off and took the battery out and everything and then put it back together and it was a blank screen. didn't even turn on.

column1: Phone is good for Talk and Text.
column2: For the price this is an OK phone. Pros: 4G phone works well, as does texting and most Apps. The WI-Fi range is very good. Battery lasts about a day and a half. Cons: There are no compass Apps that work with this phone. The camera will not focus on close-up items, so it does not work for bar code or QR code scanning.

The phone arrived on time and worked beautifully for 5 weeks. Now it is malfunctioning. The touch screen works sometimes. It freezes up. I had noticed some reviewers mentioning something similar, but thought that was there error. I would not recommend this phone. Its the roll of a dice. Will try to see if manufacturer will help

The camera is bad, Internet seems slower than any other device right next to the phone, screen unlocks a bit slow..just overall Seems like a slower processor and sort of second rate Chinese parts in some capacities compared to big cell company in store phones. Feels nice and solid though, can only complain about operation.

column1: In the beginning I thought - what a great deal for this price
column2: In the beginning I thought - what a great deal for this price. Unfortunately, the display broke after 2 weeks without falling. The cellphone was in my pocket and inside the pocket was nothing else. It was really strange. Never happened something like this to me... - Be careful, when you buy this product. -

column1: Description wrong for what companies that will run
column2: I never got to use this phone because according to its description that it could be used on Tracfone. Not true according to Tracfone the only phones that you can use are either Tracfone ones or Verizon ones. This one has Simple Mobile loaded up on it and according to them it is a sister company and you can't use.

I got it for my dad which i think the phone is easy for elderly people. However! My dad uses AT&T service, he can not connect network!!!!!!! 3G or 4G! I am so upset with this product cuz the product details says it should be worked with AT&T. Return it! and hope others could see the review!!!!

column1: I am not satisfied with my Blu Avance 4.0

column1: Broke from a manufacturing defect after 2 months of usage
column2: Terrible. After I had it for two months, the cellular connection stopped working. I checked my sim card and thats not it. It still works of WiFi, but it became useless as a phone just after the return period ended. Do not buy this phone if you expect to be able to make calls and texts.

column1: Just bought two both failed in a week!
column2: I just bought two of them and within two weeks they are both useless. One is stuck on the BLU start up screen and even a factory reset will not fix it. The other thinks the mic/earpiece is plugged in all the time and I cannot make calls that anyone can hear clearly. Even with the mic plugged in.

"It has 4 stars, how bad could it be?" Bad. Very, very bad. I just returned it kind of bad. Unusable. Awful. An insult to American design and innovation. Not worth $20, let alone $60. Do yourself a huge favor: buy a phone that costs around $100. The $40 is worth it.

column1: I don't recommend buying this phone

I don't recommend buying this phone.

column1: Dont Purcase these BLU products the have no support online for them online
column2: For the price I guess I cant ask for better I got this phone only like a month now and just last night it froze, did a battery pull and now all it does is load up to the BLU logo. Tired all kinds of stuff to restore it and nothing is working if fed up I wished I had never bought this phone.

column1: A good burner phone; otherwise, pay a little more for something better
column2: I bought this for someone who lost two phones in six months thinking that it wouldn't hurt the wallet so much if this trend continues. The phone basically does work: makes and receives calls and texts. The screen is sufficiently bright when looked at directly, but off-axis viewing is bad. Consider it a "privacy" feature, making it hard for anyone sitting next to you to peek at your screen. I found the touchscreen disappointing. The screen feels spongy - it deforms easily when touched, but more importantly, often times it takes an extra touch to get the screen to respond. Otherwise, the UI never lagged and the few apps that I tried didn't stutter. I knew it would have a stock Android build (Jellybean 4.1.2) with no or minimal improvements by BLU. Based on screenshots, it looks like the Cyanogenmod 10.2 (open-source Android OS) that I run on my Galaxy S2, and so I assumed that it would have all the features, configurability, bells, and whistles that I have. Unfortunately, it didn't. It didn't come with Cyanogenmod's powerful cLock widget or a keyboard that support gestures (think: Swype), though both could be downloaded from Google Play as the Chronos and Google Keyboard apps, respectively. It also came with very few options to customize the look feel - changing the number of icons displayed, removing the Google search bar, lock screen widgets, etc. Stock Android is not very pretty to look at so I had hoped to make the phone's interface more useful and less annoying. I returned the phone and purchased an LG Optimus F3 for $50 more. For the money, I got a better display, a better-feeling touchscreen, a much larger battery, and true 4G LTE support. (BLU's "4G" is based on those who say anything over 10Mbps is "4G", which IMO is fast enough to be usable. Others snicker and call that "faux-G".) LG also customized their Android appearance so it is more visually appealing and in some minor ways, changed buttons or moved things around to make the user experience less confusing.
Purchased it for only $50 PLUS TAX. great for the price. it's unlocked and works well. recommended

After reading other reviews I had what I believed were reasonable hopes for the phone. I received the phone only to learn that I had to purchase a SIM card for the phone. Unfortunately due to where I live I had to purchase the SIM card online. For some reason FedEx required a signature on a $0.99 SIM card. By the time I finally got the SIM card and activated service on the new phone I was 2 weeks into the return period (you are only allowed 30 days). First, the reviewers that are critical about the glare on the screen. They are ABSOLUTELY correct. I didn't think it would be such a big deal for me but I can't hardly use my phone outside for anything. Both cameras are low quality. I can't get cell service to make calls or send or receive text messages. I do work in a building where it is notoriously difficult to get a reliable cell signal but ... I will be switching back to my old phone that would at least tell me if someone tried to call. With my old phone I could actually send texts as well. I tried to give the phone a fair shake and not make a rash judgement. As a result I missed the return window and I am stuck with a sub par product.

column1: Gave it the old college try...
column2: Hello, and good day. I am currently rating this product at 3 stars, until I get my replacement unit. When I received my first model from rush direct, and was examining the phone, I noticed it refused to pick up the sim card from sim slot 1. I checked this with some other sim cards I had on hand, and ran some hardware tests via android apps. No matter what i tried, sim card reader 1 would just not work. Other than this hiccup, the phone seemed quite sturdy, everything else except the sim card 1 worked perfectly, I will update my score when i get my replacement unit, and do a full review then. Just keep in mind that Blu is a new company, so there are prone to be bugs and quality control issues as with any new startup business. I will say the experience I had with one of their other products, the BLU Dash 5.0, was very solid (if a bit too big for my uses), so hopefully the replacement unit will be as solid as that device. UPDATE: I have received the replacement unit, and unfortunately, it was just as defective as the first. I have found the radio to be defective in the replacement. Besides dropping calls left and right, it also would drain the battery extremely quickly, indicating a short of some kind in the cellular radio. I did try and pop it into the second sim card slot, and while this did solve the rapid battery drainage problem nicely, it also started to short, and began to drop calls as well. I'm guessing this particular model has a manufacturing defect in the radio or sim card reader. For those who are wondering why the battery doesn't last as long, this might have something to do with this. Overall, I can't, in good faith, recommend this product. I instead returned this, and purchased a more expensive, but still excellent for the price THL W200S, which so far has exceeded my expectations. Be warned, for the price you /could/ get a good phone, but quality control appears to be nonexistant, so buyer beware.

column1: A good burner phone; otherwise, pay a little more for something better
column2: I bought this for someone who lost two phones in six months thinking that it wouldn't hurt the wallet so much if this trend continues. The phone basically does work: makes and receives calls and texts. The screen is sufficiently bright when looked at directly, but off-axis viewing is bad. Consider it a "privacy" feature, making it hard for anyone sitting next to you to peek at your screen. I found the touchscreen disappointing. The screen feels spongy - it deforms easily when touched, but more importantly, often times it takes an extra touch to get the screen to respond. Otherwise, the UI never lagged and the few apps that I tried didn't stutter. I knew it would have a stock Android build (Jellybean 4.1.2) with no or minimal improvements by BLU. Based on screenshots, it looks like the Cyanogenmod 10.2 (open-source Android OS) that I run on my Galaxy S2, and so I assumed that it would have all the features, configurability, bells, and whistles that I have. Unfortunately, it didn't. It didn't come with Cyanogenmod's powerful cLock widget or a keyboard that support gestures (think: Swype), though both could be downloaded from Google Play as the Chronos and Google Keyboard apps, respectively. It also came with very few options to customize the look feel - changing the number of icons displayed, removing the Google search bar, lock screen widgets, etc. Stock Android is not very pretty to look at so I had hoped to make the phone's interface more useful and less annoying. I returned the phone and purchased an LG Optimus F3 for $50 more. For the money, I got a better display, a better-feeling touchscreen, a much larger battery, and true 4G LTE support. (BLU's "4G" is based on those who say anything over 10Mbps is "4G", which IMO is fast enough to be usable. Others snicker and call that "faux-G".) LG also customized their Android appearance so it is more visually appealing and in some minor ways, changed buttons or moved things around to make the user experience less confusing.

After reading other reviews I had what I believed were reasonable hopes for the phone. I received the phone only to learn that I had to purchase a SIM card for the phone. Unfortunately due to where I live I had to purchase the SIM card online. For some reason FedEx required a signature on a $0.99 SIM card. By the time I finally got the SIM card and activated service on the new phone I was 2 weeks into the return period (you are only allowed 30 days). First, the reviewers that are critical about the glare on the screen. They are ABSOLUTELY correct. I didn't think it would be such a big deal for me but I can't hardly use my phone outside for anything. Both cameras are low quality. I can't get cell service to make calls or send or receive text messages. I do work in a building where it is notoriously difficult to get a reliable cell signal but ... I will be switching back to my old phone that would at least tell me if someone tried to call. With my old phone I could actually send texts as well. I tried to give the phone a fair shake and not make a rash judgement. As a result I missed the return window and I am stuck with a sub par product.

column1: Gave it the old college try...
column2: Hello, and good day. I am currently rating this product at 3 stars, until I get my replacement unit. When I received my first model from rush direct, and was examining the phone, I noticed it refused to pick up the sim card from sim slot 1. I checked this with some other sim cards I had on hand, and ran some hardware tests via android apps. No matter what i tried, sim card reader 1 would just not work. Other than this hiccup, the phone seemed quite sturdy, everything else except the sim card 1 worked perfectly, I will update my score when i get my replacement unit, and do a full review then. Just keep in mind that Blu is a new company, so there are prone to be bugs and quality control issues as with any new startup business. I will say the experience I had with one of their other products, the BLU Dash 5.0, was very solid (if a bit too big for my uses), so hopefully the replacement unit will be as solid as that device. UPDATE: I have received the replacement unit, and unfortunately, it was just as defective as the first. I have found the radio to be defective in the replacement. Besides dropping calls left and right, it also would drain the battery extremely quickly, indicating a short of some kind in the cellular radio. I did try and pop it into the second sim card slot, and while this did solve the rapid battery drainage problem nicely, it also started to short, and began to drop calls as well. I'm guessing this particular model has a manufacturing defect in the radio or sim card reader. For those who are wondering why the battery doesn't last as long, this might have something to do with this. Overall, I can't, in good faith, recommend this product. I instead returned this, and purchased a more expensive, but still excellent for the price THL W200S, which so far has exceeded my expectations. Be warned, for the price you /could/ get a good phone, but quality control appears to be nonexistant, so buyer beware.
